column1: ","Help us put the public in Public Art!

Knit the Bridge is a grassroots arts project – a huge, visually amazing fiberart installation on a downtown Pittsburgh bridge.  Nearly 600 brilliantly colored, afghan-sized panels knitted and crocheted by area residents will be used to decorate – or ""yarnbomb"" – one of Pittsburgh’s iconic Three Sisters bridges.  When the project goes up later this year it will be the largest such fiberart installation in the U.S.A. ever.

Knit the Bridge (KtB) doesn't aim simply to transform public space. We want to transform the way our communities work, play, and interact with each other. Knit the Bridge reaches deep into diverse neighborhoods and brings people together in new ways to knit, crochet, design, install, and collaborate. Over the past year, we've organized hundreds of local events and knit-ins. When drivers, bikers, boaters, and pedestrians admire the bridge's fabulous new look, we want them o see the full range of ages, ethnicities, gender identities, abilities, and economic groups that comprise our vibrant corner of the rustbelt.
What it takes

Knit the Bridge is a labor of love and commitment that started with the Fiberarts Guild of Pittsburgh, a local nonprofit organization committed to the creative development, appreciation, and preservation of the fiber arts.  Local funders and arts organizations jumped on the bandwagon to help us buy materials and reach out to various communities.  Boosted by so many supporters, volunteers, community leaders, and amazing knitters... we are in the home stretch of a landmark project that can light up the Pittsburgh region and serve as a model for other cities.  But we need help to go the distance.  We are hoping to raise $35,000 to pay installation costs, ensure public safety, and reuse the materials.
In case you’re wondering...

What happens to all that knitting once the project comes down?  Most of the bridge panels will be thoroughly laundered, repaired, and donated to neighborhood shelters. Some pieces will be given as thank you perks to indiegogo donors. Check out our perks listed on the sidebar and on our blog: http://knitthebridge.wordpress.com/indiegogo/
How you can help

At Knit the Bridge every person counts, every stitch gets us closer to our end goal. There are many ways to participate including donating funds, spreading the word, and signing up on our website to help assemble, prep, and install for the bridge.
Like
Share
Donate
Thank you!

Every penny we raise will go toward the project’s costs, including materials, the installation costs, and stipends.  Any amount beyond our funding goal will allow us to create a documentary chronicling our community journey and the installation and also help reimburse the expenses of a few volunteers who have donated months of time and expertise to Knit the Bridge.
This is just a fraction of the money we need to raise, if we go over our goal it will free us from having to raise it through other means and get us knitting again! Thank you for your contribution.
What is ""yarnbombing""?

Coming out of the street art and contemporary craft movements, ""yarnbombing"" is a fun, bright, beautiful way to celebrate public space. Unlike graffiti, ""yarnbombing"" can be done without any damage to historic structures and is temporary and easily removable.
Knit the Bridge Perks
When you contribute on indiegogo, you get a thank you gift. Choose from our list of perks based on the dollar amount.
Perk #1 – Knit the Bridge Temporary Tattoo $5 contribution - 2""x2"" temporary tatto with the bridge illustration.  Made in the USA.
Perk #2 - Knit the Bridge Postcard - $10 contribution -Unlimited perks available  – A thank you postcard with the Knit the Bridge illustration sent directly to you.

Perk #3 – Knit the Bridge Patch - $15 contribution -150 perks available – The Knit the Bridge illustration on a swatch of poly/cotton.  Use it as inspiration for your own garment or accessory.  We find these are fabulous on bags, jeans, and other accessories.  It lets folks know that you helped make Knit the Bridge happen.

Perk #4 – Knit the Bridge Pattern Collection $20 contribution -Unlimited perks available - A collection of patterns made especially for Knit the Bridge, designed by local fiber artist, Cosette Cornelius-Bates (aka cosymakes).  The collection includes a funky earflap hat, super duper warm pair of mittens or fingerless mitts, and a warm and woolie headband.
Perk #5 -  Handcrafted Buttons! $25 - 100 perks available - Hand-crafted colorful buttons made by polymer clay artist, Laura Tabakman. Buttons come in a pack of 6.

Perk #6 – Book – Knitting Wool Diaper Covers from Start to Finish  $50 - 4 perks available -Knitting Wool Diaper Covers from Start to Finish - a spiral-bound book on creating your own wool diaper covers by local Pittsburgh designer and writer, Maggie Broderick of Burgh Baby Gear.

Perk #7 - Book - Bridges of Pittsburgh $50 - 10 perks available Paperback bound book with photos of the many bridges of Pittsburgh, written by Bob Regan with photographs by Tim Fabian. Includes ten self-guided tours for walkers, cyclists, drivers, and boaters.

Perk #8 – Bridge Tee $60 - 100 perks available -One Knit the Bridge T-shirt with the Knit the Bridge illustration screen-printed by Pittsburgh's own Commonwealth Press.  Choose your size from S M L XL XXL - Colors: Gold, Sky, Orange, Kiwi, Gray, Coral, Heather Royal, or Heather Green

Perk #9 - Knit the Bridge Hand-dyed + Patterns - $75 - 39 perks available - One skein of the exclusive Knit the Bridge colorway - hand-dyed worsted weight wool.  Dyed at a Southside Monastery, we started with bridge yellow and then over-dyed one warm colorway and one cool colorway. Comes with the KtB Pattern Collection: KtB Headband, Knit the Mitts, and Knit the Bridge Hat.  All are original designs by local fiber artist, Cosymakes. To dye for... Self pick up to chose your skein, or if you're out of town we can ship it.

Perk #10 - Knit the Bridge Hand-dyed x2 + Patterns - $150 - 20 perks available Two skeins of the exclusive KtB colorway - hand-dyed worsted weight wool. Dyed at a Southside Monastery, we started with bridge yellow and then over-dyed one warm colorway and one cool colorway. You get one of each. These gorgeous skeins come with the KtB Pattern Collection: KtB Headband, Knit the Mitts, and Knit the Bridge Hat.  All are original designs by local fiber artist, Cosymakes. To dye for... Self pick up to chose your skeins, or if you're out of town we can ship it.

Help Make Art Desks Happen

Dear Friends. Thank you for supporting Art
Desks. The book is coming along beautifully.  However, Art Desks can

only happen if I reach my fundraising goal.

My IndieGoGo Campaign has ended. However, there are several ways you can still help.
1. Pre-Purchase the Book for $50
2. Purchase a Limited Edition Print
2. Collect a $25 and $50 iPhone Print
3. Donate

Daylight Books to publish this work in the fall of 2014. Art Desks will
be distributed by D.A.P. Distributed Art Publishers with text by Andy
Grundberg. The book will feature 57 photographs of art desks throughout
the East Coast. This is my first book produced with an independent

publisher and I am super excited. Thank you for your support! Brady

About The Book

http://www.art-desks.com/

Art
Desks features photographs of the desks and working spaces of artists,
curators, art dealers, critics and tastemakers throughout the East Coast. This
series began in 2011 in Washington, D.C. and has since expanded to other art
markets. This series explores the idea of desk as portrait combined with the
social experiment of navigating the art world.
Art Desks has received a lot of support at home and abroad. It has always been
my goal to produce a book on this series. I’m super excited for this
opportunity. Between now and May, I will expand this series and photograph more
art desks between NY and Miami.
These photographs will be published by Daylight Books in the fall of next year.
The 8-inch-by-10-inch hardbound book will feature 96 photographs of art desks. This will be
my first book published with an independent publisher and I am asked to help
front the production costs of this book.
I’m here to ask for your help. This book can only happen if I meet my
fundraising goal. Please consider making a donation today or pre-purchase a
signed book, photograph, commissioned desk portrait or private portfolio review.
Please tell your friends to spread the word and get involved. Thank you very
much.

About The Photographer

E. Brady Robinson received
her BFA in photography from The Maryland Institute, College of Art in
Baltimore, Maryland and her MFA in photography from Cranbrook Art Academy
in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan. Robinson
maintains a studio in Washington, DC and Orlando, Florida.
What We Need &
In order to publish
this first of its kind book, we must raise at least $20,000 to pay for
production costs including: Printing, Design, and Shipping.
This is an amazing opportunity to:
·  Collect an original signed book of its
kind featuring photographs of Art Desks from NY to Miami
·  Collect a photograph at a fraction of
the price
·  Commission a one-of-a-kind desk
portrait of your own workspace by the photographer
·  Purchase a private portfolio review via
SKYPE
·  Attend an invite-only book signing
party in NYC
·  Attend a private book launch party and
opening reception to the solo exhibition of Art Desks at Addison/Ripley Fine
Art in Georgetown during FotoWeekDC 2014 in Washington, DC
·  Attend a private invite only opening
reception and feature of Art Desks at SNAP! Space in Orlando, Florida in the

fall 2014 

·  Your support in any amount will help fund the production of Brady's first book published with Daylight Books


Bethany Hansen and Ann-Marie
VanTassell, Artists. Washington, D.C. by E. Brady Robinson 2013. 6x9” inch archival pigment
print, signed and open edition available for $125.

Larissa Leclair, Founder of Indie Photobook Library and Independent Curator. Washington, D.C. by E. Brady Robinson 2011. 6x9” inch archival pigment print, signed and open edition available for $125.


The Impact
This book can only happen if I reach my
fundraising goal. In shooting this work, I’ve come face to face with the
complexities, literal and social of navigating the art world. This book is a
first of its kind, the images are insightful and richly detailed, the project
as a whole exhibits the “six degrees of separation” inherent to the art world,
my heroes, my community. Not only will the book provide a visual time stamp of
the workspace of individuals contributing to art and culture on the East Coast,
but will also be a significant achievement in my career as a fine art
photographer.
Other
Ways You Can Help
Please
consider making a donation of at least $15 today. Every little bit helps. And,
please Tweet, Facebook post, Instagram, and email this campaign to your friends
and followers. That is a BIG way to help! Use the share tools right here on the
site.<span>  Please tell your friends to spread
the word and get involved. Thank you very much.
Previous Success
This series began in 2011 in
Washington, DC and has since expanded to other art markets. Art Desks has received
a lot of support at home and abroad. Previous success includes:
Grand Prize Winner in American Life exhibition featured in the 2011 Lishui Photography Festival, China
Art
Desks DC received the Grand Prize Award and Cash Prize of $10,000
RMB in the American Life exhibition in the 2011 Lishui
Photography Festival, China. Select work from the DC series was selected by
independent curator Larissa Leclair from the Indie Photobook Library. The 2011
Lishui Photography Festival is the largest International Photography Festival
in China. American Life was produced by Yan Li, Director of
<b>High Noon Culture &amp
column2: Art Corp in Beijing, China and featured 20 American

column1: photographers selected by 10 American Curators. The
exhibition continued after the festival for a one-year tour in major galleries and museums throughout
China including ShiJiaZhuang Art Museum China (2012) and 2013 Dali Photo
Festival in China.
This project has also been featured in
The Washington Post, Channel One Russia TV, The Bund Shanghai and DC City
Paper.

The I Ching is an Ancient Chinese Oracle based in Taoist, including Yin and Yang, principles which can be consulted for advice and guidance in all of life’s situations. This new edition features paintings for each of the 64 hexagrams by Australian artist Flora Beresford whose works have been on exhibition at the Art Gallery of NSW. Along with the artwork, the book features text of Flora’s own interpretation of each hexagrams drawing from her broad studies.

This edition is ready for print and includes an introduction by the archivist of the Art Gallery of NSW. Publisher is registered and we already have the ISBN for this edition.

Australian artist Flora Beresford, who was an art student in Sydney in the 1930s, eventually moved to India, where she lived for nearly 30 years. She and her family quickly integrated into Indian society. One of her sons even became Sri Dev Ashish, successor to the line of gurus at the Mirtola ashram.

 Flora's fascinating series of watercolours, based on the ancient Chinese oracle and Book of Changes, as well as on the Tarot and traditional Indian spirituality, trace the impact of esoteric thought and art on an artist trained in the vitalist tradition of Rayner Hoff.

Please send a teacher to art school...

I have been accepted into Savannah College of Art and Design's MFA in Painting. This is my dream come true as an artist and as an elementary art teacher. Even though I have received both academic and artistic scholarships, as an art teacher within North Carolina's public schools, I am still unable to meet the remaining expenses :'(

I am asking for your help to cover the $500 commitment fee. This guarantees my spot in the summer 2014 cohort. Because the majority of the program is online, I will be able to continue teaching and sharing with every one of my 575 students while at the same time taking classes and improving as an artist and educator.

As a start, I need $500 to send to Savannah College of Art and Design to commit to the eLearning Masters of Fine Art in Painting. I will also need to fund the 5 week residency, so any funding beyond the $500 (oh I hope, I hope!) will go toward housing in Savannah for the summer.
The result...

By personally growing as an artist, I will directly and immediately affect all of my elementary school students. If arts education is important to you, this is a way to directly help someone who creates with children every day.
Are you a starvin' artist/educator too?

Is a donation is not within your means? Please pass this on to someone who also believes in the power of art education who may be able to assist me financially.

column2:
>{she crew}: empowering girls, supporting their voices, and engaging their superpowers.

{she crew} is a multidisciplinary journaling to performance empowerment program for girls.  We are here to support girls at a time of transition, focus their individual voice, create a safe space for self-expression, and facilitate a community that aides in the development of all of its members.

We are exploring the question of what it is to be a woman, how one defines womanhood, and how we see ourselves in relation to that definition.  But what we are truly asking is how these girls see their own futures.

Our programming is made to be accessible to girls who come from low income families, so that people of all backgrounds can be part of our community.

To make that possible we have:

1. Made programming free for participants.

2. Will provide free transit cards to be used to and from program.

3. Will provide 1 meal per day, prepared and shared by instructors and students.

Your donations are going towards funding our Pilot Summer Session, which will impact the lives of 12 girls this June 16th through July 26th.  That is programming for 6 weeks, 4 days a week, 4 hours a day. At the end of program there will be 3 performances for you to catch!  All content will be written and performed by the {she crew} participants!

The $13,000 goes to:

{she crew} rental space CivicLab!  Without this space, we cannot have a program.

Food. We provide one free meal a day to participants.

Transit Cards. Without transit cards, we cannot ensure that our participants can make it to and from program each day.

Class Materials. There are a lot of materials that go into making a successful arts program. Think pens, journals, art supplies, yoga mats, etc. 

Administrative Costs. We have an incredible team working to make {she crew} happen. The crew members are working around the clock to ensure this groundbreaking and one-of-a-kind program can exist. 

Our Very Talented Videographer.  He made the video above, yay!  He will also catch moments throughout program, so we may have first rate marketing materials, as well as state-of-the-art assessments to better the future of {she crew}!
column4:
>and 

Instructors!  

But most importantly... There are a lot of people giving their time, skill, and love to make {she crew} happen, and working at a massive discount because they believe in the cause. It is not news that being an adolescent girl is difficult. We've all been there or know someone who has been there. Everyone involved in {she crew} is working for little or nothing to ensure that these 12 girls receive support, community, artistic outlets, and a boost in confidence, in this incredibly formative age that will impact them for years to come.  

The power of one girl is incredible, but the power of two, or three, or twelve is infinite! Our students are at a formative age, when girls begin to identify with particular cliques and trends, and create a long lasting idea of who they are.  Carol Gilligan, a revolutionist in the academic world of psychology and gender studies, described this age in girls as: a ""watershed in female development, a time when girls are in danger of drowning or disappearing"".  {she crew}'s empowerment message is meant to be preventative
column5:
to give girls tools, artistic outlets, and a grounding sense of self, to help them through their later teen years.  When you give one girl the tools to be confident and speak her mind, she inspires others to do the same.  

Other ways to contribute:

{1.} Come to our physical fundraiser!

"" {she crew}'s Sadie Hawkins Dance!""

Where: La Bruquena in Humboldt Park, Chicago, IL.

When: April 11th at 9pm.

{She's inviting you!}

{2.} In Kind Donations!  

Have more pens than you know what to do with?  Want to give enough yoga mats for each girl to have one during program? Did you accidentally buy way too much rice and want to donate it to {she crew}'s meal fund?  You can!  {she crew} will happily accept non-perishable foods, classroom materials, or really almost everything that directly feeds into our philosophy or curriculum.  

Just email us a shecrewinfo@gmail.com

{3.} Spread the word and volunteer!

We are a grassroots organization and word of mouth is EVERYTHING! Know a girl who would benefit? Send her to our Apply page on our website! Know a great human who would dig our mission? Tell them! Know a fabulous organization or potential donor? 

Send them to our indiegogo or our website! And don't forget to share this indiegogo!

Thank you so much!

{she crew} out.


","{she crew}: empowering girls, supporting their voices, and engaging their superpowers.{she crew} is a multidisciplinary journaling to performance empowerment program for girls.  We are here to support girls at a time of transition, focus their individual voice, create a safe space for self-expression, and facilitate a community that aides in the development of all of its members.We are exploring the question of what it is to be a woman, how one defines womanhood, and how we see ourselves in relation to that definition.  But what we are truly asking is how these girls see their own futures.Our programming is made to be accessible to girls who come from low income families, so that people of all backgrounds can be part of our community.To make that possible we have:1. Made programming free for participants.2. Will provide free transit cards to be used to and from program.3. Will provide 1 meal per day, prepared and shared by instructors and students.Your donations are going towards funding our Pilot Summer Session, which will impact the lives of 12 girls this June 16th through July 26th.  That is programming for 6 weeks, 4 days a week, 4 hours a day. At the end of program there will be 3 performances for you to catch!  All content will be written and performed by the {she crew} participants!The $13,000 goes to:{she crew} rental space CivicLab!  Without this space, we cannot have a program.Food. We provide one free meal a day to participants.Transit Cards. Without transit cards, we cannot ensure that our participants can make it to and from program each day.Class Materials. There are a lot of materials that go into making a successful arts program. Our project!

I am Emily, a wife, mother, artist, and nurse who is planning on traveling to Uganda this summer to take photos to paint from. My talented husband Mark Carder and I will paint 8-10 oil paintings, hold an art show, and give the profits to Amazima, Ekisa, and Serving His Children to use as needed.... and the needs are great!  

Our project is to raise much needed funds for these ministries, to provide any supplies they may need and finally to help others realize that the World Needs More people like those that live for others!

But before I go, I need to buy my plane tickets and would like to buy any supplies that are needed and can be delivered on my way over.
column4:
>                                                          


Above is a child that Serving His Children helped by providing nutrition for the child and nutrition education for the mother.  


Ekisa is a non-profit that provides for the needs of those living with disabilities in Uganda.



At Amazima the mission is ""Helping to Educate and Empower the People of Uganda with God's Love"".



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with a financial gift, then please consider helping by sharing my campaign with others who may be able to.   

Many, many thanks!! And those that contributed earlier.... thank you and your funds will be used wisely!

column42:
Challenges

The project have been approved by the Major of Livorno and each involved alderman, and the council will remain in charge for other five years. 

  • After 2020, if the park will be a success, there is no reasons for the new council to change the winning horse...
  • In any case all the artworks can be easily moved to a new location where the Giardino Sonoro could start again to amaze the public...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • ...use the Indiegogo share tools!

column1: ","Short Summary

The purpose of the project is to promote tourism and culture in Livorno by combining the basic principles of ecology and Art. Specifically, the installation provides for the exploitation of public areas that need to be upgraded, the possibility of interaction and the necessary accessibility for its use, with zero environmental impact and all this at a very low cost as the result of a free collaboration between citizens and experts. Will be considered the possibility of involving young students in training activity designed to raise awareness of the musical culture, education and listening in the broadest sense, a self-awareness that contributes to the formation of the individual's harmony.
What We Need & What You Get
We will give extra value to your help:

We need only a small amount of money to help the artists in the practical building activity of their artworks. The project is mainly based on volunteers efforts that will use a few of Euro to realize a place that will represent an incredibly higher value for all the world community.

Even in the eventuality that we don't reach our entire goal, your help will be still useful and rewarded with a mention in the label relative to the artworks for which your contribution have been used (for a minimal contribute of 10 Euro).    The Impact

The Sound Garden, for as designed, would represent a real pearl for our city, since no installation of this kind is currently present in Italy. The cultural property should be made with recycled materials and based on works of art made primarily of contemporary artists from Livorno, though, the originality of the work and its character involving sound, music and ecology, the place (already in the design phase) has caught the attention of some Florentine artists and they have expressed a desire to contribute to the eventual realization of the work. A sound garden consists of an area of a public park in which visitors can listen to the sounds naturally produced by the passage of the wind through particular sculptures or create new sounds by interacting, more or less consciously, with mechanical instruments acts to produce pitched sounds. Obviously the experience is synesthetic and educational at the same time because of the observation of the same implicit sculptures and the ability to analyze the technologies used for the construction of the works. The place appointed for the construction is the ""Fortezza Nuova"". The park should be be visited during the day until sunset, with variable hours during the year according to the seasons and daylight savings time.

Before electronics, computer and reproducibility magnetic work of art (see. Benjamin), the place of execution had a vital importance for the correct use of the artwork, often created according to the characteristics of the environment deputy for public performance or for the exhibition of the work. Then to start again from the places of culture, their specificity and uniqueness still full of intrinsic and immutable, heedless of the frenzy of modern consumerism empty and insubstantial, it seems to us the only option. Transforming a park of Livorno, a good of the community, in an unique outdoor art installation, it seemed like an interesting idea as a result from different points of view.
The presence in the cultural group of a leading expert in Italian audio immersive soundscape, guided the choice of the media to be used to convey the contents toward the sound.

Inside the parks, instead, it would be amusing and educational for all if very simple acoustic instruments were to be made available, observing similarly simple safety precautions: small unmovable drums, tuned and not tuned, woodblocks and marimbas and their sticks with felt or soft rubber tips and secured by chains. Next to the obligatory swings and slides there could be aviaries with birds, as long as the level of pollution doesn’t affect them. They would greatly enrich the sound landscape. Ideally we could even create arenas inspired by the ancient Greeks, with the same excellent acoustics, in order to encourage people to perform in theatre shows and poetry reviews. In enclosed parks with permanent surveillance, we could go as far installing aeolian harps, rainwater drums and wind xylophones..."" excerpt from Creating Soundscapes, ASIN:B0047GN99C written by Luigi Agostini in 2008.   Risks & Challenges  The project have been approved by the Major of Livorno and each involved alderman, and the council will remain in charge for other five years.   After 2020, if the park will be a success, there is no reasons for the new council to change the winning horse... In any case all the artworks can be easily moved to a new location where the Giardino Sonoro could start again to amaze the public... column1: If you have a sweet tooth and/or want to live to be 100...Get the book and some black sugar! You've never tasted healthy sugar this good. A one-way ticket for your senses straight to a little known island of southern Okinawa. Perfect reading for the kids, too. Don't have kids? Give the book to a friend who does! I need your contribution now to publish this work properly in August.

""It is interesting that Okinawa is famous for enjoying the greatest longevity among the entire Japanese population, and the Japanese themselves have the longest life span in the world. The consumption of pure Kokuto black sugar along with plenty seaweed, tofu and pork (yes, pork!) is believed to contribute to the healthy long life of Okinawans.""
(Old-fashioned boiler room on Ishigaki, stirring the ""Kokuto"" black sugar)
Short Summary
J Muzacz is...
Artist/author of
column4: keywords=japan+365#reader_098531270X"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Japan 365: A Drawing-A-Day Project, English teacher in Kyoto, environmental awareness rider with Bicycle for Everyone's Earth, urban art instructor with ""at-risk"" youth, painter of countless murals in more than 5 countries and... a sugarcane farmer???

column1: This latest project, after three-months of back-breaking labor in the ""satou-kibi"" sugarcane fields, will be the first EVER picture book in English about the field, cute critters therein, traditional and modern harvest and processing methods and some of the colorful local characters involved here on Ishigaki Island.

As a contributor NOW through Indiegogo, YOU will help to publish the First Edition hardcover book Life Is Sweet, thus creating a useful cultural time capsule, preserving a way of life for many, and helping to teach this generation and future generations about the delicious sugarcane that the Yaeyama Islands and Okinawa are famous for.

Written and illustrated from first-hand experience, a new kind of book for the public library and your house. A culturally enlightening story about teamwork, community and protecting nature and respecting tradition that you can read with the kids!

column1: This is a wonderful opportunity for me to share a special piece of Ishigaki Island. I encourage anyone with the time and means to visit. There is scuba diving with manta rays, snorkeling the coral reef, kayaking mangrove forests, hiking Okinawa's tallest mountain Omoto peak, birdwatching, cute cafes offering delicious local delicacies (lots of seaweed!), nearby island hopping to preserved Ryukyu villages and people that are genuinely laid-back and friendly offering infinite hospitality.
But for NOW, let me send You some ""Kokuto"" Black Sugar to munch on while you read your SWEET new book! Grab your PERK on the right! >

If my goal is not reached, publication will still be possible for print-on-demand books for those of you who chose a book perk. Sugar and other Ishigaki souvenir perks are also covered by your contribution. So NO WORRIES, You will get your perks as promised when you donate - if that is the case I will just have to scrounge up funds and foot the rest of the associated publication costs with my meager migrant laborer earnings :(
So, please contribute now! :)
<div>
The IMPACT

Life Is Sweet will be the first ever picture book in English about the Ishigaki Island sugarcane harvest. That means the book will be a great asset in preserving the traditional and current histories being written as farmers plow their fields and the big factory or small local presses process their cane. My shared experience will provide a deeper understanding of the various aspects of the region-specific work that rough and weathered farmers must do each year to satisfy the national sweet tooth. I worked the fields myself blistered, bug-bitten, sunburnt, busted and bruised in order to accurately offer this special in-depth look at an annual way of life for many - a means to survive on beautiful, yet typhoon-ridden, windswept island gems like Ishigaki.

Meeting a local farmer with generations of experience and a wealth of knowledge about all aspects of growing and harvesting satou-kibi sugarcane, I was very lucky as a foreigner to be taken under wing, trained and gain first hand experience from the start. I feel obliged thus to recreate through colorful images bound with an insightful story what I have seen, felt and learned in a FUN way.

This local history is completely unique to the Yaeyama Islands of Ryukyu Okinawa, though many underlying themes and struggles on this small island represent much greater universal issues. For instance, that of modern farmers worldwide balancing environmental costs and benefits associated with growing crops we all love and can't get enough of, the importance of cultivating teamwork and healthy community, respecting tradition while increasingly utilizing new technologies to maximize efficiency, AND that unmatched contentment you feel after completing a long, hard day's work.
(Well-known sugarcane farmer and his grandson)
<div>

Fundraising here on Indiegogo to publish my first book, JAPAN 365: A Drawing-A-Day Project was such a huge success last year that I realized a great potential within my tight group of friends, family, acquaintances and their respective networks. Supporting my creative pursuit in exchange for some authentic storytelling through my own experience using easy-to-understand pictures is the least I can do for you to show my humble appreciation for your help and support today contributing toward the successful publication of Life Is Sweet. But, I can't do it without your generous contributions!

Short Summary
J Muzacz is...

Artist/author of Japan 365: A Drawing-A-Day Project, English teacher in Kyoto, environmental awareness rider with Bicycle for Everyone's Earth, urban art instructor with ""at-risk"" youth, painter of countless murals in more than 5 countries and... a sugarcane farmer???

This latest project, after three-months of back-breaking labor in the ""satou-kibi"" sugarcane fields, will be the first EVER picture book in English about the field, cute critters therein, traditional and modern harvest and processing methods and some of the colorful local characters involved here on Ishigaki Island.

As a contributor NOW through Indiegogo, YOU will help to publish the First Edition hardcover book Life Is Sweet, thus creating a useful cultural time capsule, preserving a way of life for many, and helping to teach this generation and future generations about the delicious sugarcane that the Yaeyama Islands and Okinawa are famous for.

Written and illustrated from first-hand experience, a new kind of book for the public library and your house. A culturally enlightening story about teamwork, community and protecting nature and respecting tradition that you can read with the kids!
RAVE REVIEWS for Life Is Sweet artwork from some tough critics... A couple old men on Ishigaki - shopkeeper and a black sugar maker:
You've got sonzaikan."" (Sonzaikan is a word meaning the 'feeling of existence,' or 'life of the party,' can be both good and bad...I think he meant in the good way
You can feel real Okinawa - a little. From an outsider? Great! Bring many books here, I'll buy them.""
Also, some good press from METROPOLIS TOKYO magazine here.
Click the Gallery tab above to see some fresh new illustrations! Or check out even more on Facebook - LIFE IS SWEET album.
Recent article I wrote for Okinawa Stripes News - Do you take sugar?
Listen to the brand new ""LIFE IS SWEET"" track by MANATEEMANN on SoundCloud here
What you GET - PERKS
SWEET Perks I want to send to YOU straight from Ishigaki for contributing:
1) LIFE IS SWEET - The Hardcover BOOK in FULL COLOR  (It's Cool!)
2) A Bag of Authentic Ishigaki ""KOKUTO"" Black Rock Sugar  (It's Sweet!)
3) ISHIGAKI T-Shirt and Surprise Island Souvenirs  (It's Super!)
4) FIVE books, plus stickers, to Share with friends  (Sharing is caring!)
5) PRODUCER Credit - YOUR NAME printed in EVERY BOOK  (It's Epic!)
6) Digital Book Download (PDF) of Life Is Sweet (It's Digital!)
*Just to clarify, book size will actually be 8.5""x11""- that's right, BIGGER than the 6x9"" stated at right!

**Perks and minimum contribution required to receive them outlined on the right. All minimums include shipping. You CAN contribute more, though, or get more than just one perk! Books will come with a unique one-off dedication sticker, written personally from me to you, for the inside cover of your book(s). All perks get you a digital download (PDF), too. Please ask me via comment here or by email if you need any clarification about perks, jmuzacz@gmail.com.

***When you contribute, opt to get campaign updates like new posts, pictures, video and song from Ishigaki. Then forward your friends about it. Like these little friends from the field - a frightened field mouse and a poisonous ""habu"" pit viper!
What I need from YOU - $$$upport

To cover the cost of publication, printing and distribution of Life Is Sweet, I need your monetary contribution now in exchange for SWEET perks, like your own copy of the BOOK and Black Sugar! Estimated production cost budget (in USD):
Design, proofreading, editing and promotion = 1000
Scanning, ISBN and barcode, Library of Congress, copyright, set-up = 199
Printing hardcover (cloth cover with dust jacket) books = 16.90 per unit (ouch!), 200 books = 3380
Shipping = varies, min. $4 per book (more for international orders) = 800
Other perks (sugar - 5/bag, Tee - 15 ea., souvenirs) - 1000
Misc. (stickers, packaging materials, etc.) - 300
*Total = $6679  (*Excluding % fees to Indiegogo and Paypal)

This is a wonderful opportunity for me to share a special piece of Ishigaki Island. I encourage anyone with the time and means to visit. There is scuba diving with manta rays, snorkeling the coral reef, kayaking mangrove forests, hiking Okinawa's tallest mountain Omoto peak, birdwatching, cute cafes offering delicious local delicacies (lots of seaweed!), nearby island hopping to preserved Ryukyu villages and people that are genuinely laid-back and friendly offering infinite hospitality.
But for NOW, let me send You some ""Kokuto"" Black Sugar to munch on while you read your SWEET new book! Grab your PERK on the right! >>

If my goal is not reached, publication will still be possible for print-on-demand books for those of you who chose a book perk. Sugar and other Ishigaki souvenir perks are also covered by your contribution. So NO WORRIES, You will get your perks as promised when you donate - if that is the case I will just have to scrounge up funds and foot the rest of the associated publication costs with my meager migrant laborer earnings :(
So, please contribute now! :)
The IMPACT

Life Is Sweet will be the first ever picture book in English about the Ishigaki Island sugarcane harvest. That means the book will be a great asset in preserving the traditional and current histories being written as farmers plow their fields and the big factory or small local presses process their cane. My shared experience will provide a deeper understanding of the various aspects of the region-specific work that rough and weathered farmers must do each year to satisfy the national sweet tooth. I worked the fields myself blistered, bug-bitten, sunburnt, busted and bruised in order to accurately offer this special in-depth look at an annual way of life for many - a means to survive on beautiful, yet typhoon-ridden, windswept island gems like Ishigaki.

Meeting a local farmer with generations of experience and a wealth of knowledge about all aspects of growing and harvesting satou-kibi sugarcane, I was very lucky as a foreigner to be taken under wing, trained and gain first hand experience from the start. I feel obliged thus to recreate through colorful images bound with an insightful story what I have seen, felt and learned in a FUN way.

This local history is completely unique to the Yaeyama Islands of Ryukyu Okinawa, though many underlying themes and struggles on this small island represent much greater universal issues. For instance, that of modern farmers worldwide balancing environmental costs and benefits associated with growing crops we all love and can't get enough of, the importance of cultivating teamwork and healthy community, respecting tradition while increasingly utilizing new technologies to maximize efficiency, AND that unmatched contentment you feel after completing a long, hard day's work.
(Well-known sugarcane farmer and his grandson)

Fundraising here on Indiegogo to publish my first book, JAPAN 365: A Drawing-A-Day Project was such a huge success last year that I realized a great potential within my tight group of friends, family, acquaintances and their respective networks. Supporting my creative pursuit in exchange for some authentic storytelling through my own experience using easy-to-understand pictures is the least I can do for you to show my humble appreciation for your help and support today contributing toward the successful publication of Life Is Sweet. But, I can't do it without your generous contributions!
Other Ways You Can HELP
Some people just can’t contribute $ for perks right now, and that is totally fine. But you CAN still help by:
Getting the word out, make some NOISE! Online and in REAL LIFE (Tell your friends, the local paper, your favorite magazine or blog, send a link)
Use Indiegogo easy share tools- E-mail, Facebook, post a Link, Tweet it, Blog it, etc. ^Easy buttons above!^
That’s really all there is to it. And don't quit until we reach the goal!
Thank you! Doumo Arigatou! Mifaiyu! (Local Yaeyama dialect)
Don't forget to Contribute, Grab your PERK, and tell your friends TODAY!",10.0,0,"4 Campaigns
|","Ishigaki, Japan",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/life-is-sweet/pica

Art and peace lovers and all the ones who care for a better world are kindly invited to help me print a unique art calendar of macro photography of my glass objects MICRO IDEAS FOR MACRO PEACE in 2013 in 1000 copies to unite and promote art, peace and human values and to distribute it around the globe to the ones that care. The size of the calendar is 18.5 x 13 in (47 x 33 cm) and it will be printed in the highest quality.

From my collection of macros, I have chosen 13 amazing images of my glass works and designed a beautiful calendar. On the last page of the calendar you can see small pictures with the titles for each month of the new year:
Inspirations, Harmony, Diversity, Union, Oneness, Peace, Love, Beauty, Wisdom, Subtlety, Silence and Abundance.

You can also see a list of organizations who will get this calendar as a gift and with the main idea behind it is clearly explained. On the back side of the calendar there are names of all who will support it. Please, put your name on it together with the ones that are already there.
Together with all of you, I intend to send this calendar to United Nations, Greenpeace, AVAAZ, Unicef, Amnesty International, PETA, ONE, Bill &
column2: Melinda Gates Foundation, The Carter Center, William J. Clinton Foundation, Nelson Mandela Foundation, Dalai Lama, The HUmane Society INternational, The Burma Campaign UK, Bono, Leonardo di Caprio, Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie ...

column1: You can also suggest who else would be entitled to get it, too.

With the power of transformation through art in mind, I sincerely believe that  together we can do much more to make this planet a better world for each of us. So, through this project, I would like to thank many for their present contribution and I would like to encourage others to do more.
This project is inspirational and huge, so I would need a lot of support from many individuals that really care. We will succeed thanks to Kerubin, Indiegogo and YOU.
In my 22 years of active participation in art and ecology, I have realized around 150 non-commercial projects, so I sincerely hope you may trust me and support this one.
Thanks for having heART for art.
With love and respect,
M I R A N D A  R U M I N A
To see the beautiful rewards please click on http://www.kerubin.com/?c=en/shop/mugs

Please join SCRAP Bin in our historical record breaking effort to build the world's largest plastic bottle sculpture, a giant dragon! Visit the dragon sculpture under construction at Mecca Fest on October 13th and 14th at the Cultural Arts Center in downtown Carrollton.
Ways you can help:

-Sponsor the Dragon! All donations will go to benefit SCRAP Bin in its mission to reduce the amount of material going to the landfill, educate the community, and provide resources for teachers. Please view the toolbar to your right to explore our varied sponsorship levels for every budget.  The perks for each donation level ""stack up"" meaning if you give a gift at $50, you also get the perks from the lower donation levels as well. Donations of $100 or more will also have your individual name, family, or business or organization name listed on a plaque at the statue's permanent home (TBD). A tax deductible donation receipt is available upon request.
-Collect bottles and deliver them to our retail location in Lake Carroll Mall (next to Big Lots) or volunteer to help build the dragon! Call for details (770) 666-5332
About the SCRAP Bin:

SCRAP Bin is a center for donated materials that are redistributed for creative reuse. We are located in Carrollton, Georgia and are partnered with Keep Carroll Beautiful, a local nonprofit program dedicated to recycling and beautification of Carroll County.
You can find more details about our mission, programs, values, goals, staff, etc. at our website http://www.scrapbin.org/about_us.php
SCRAP Bin was started in 2010 with a generous seed grant from the Alice H. Richards Education &
column2: Environment Fund of the Community Foundation of West Georgia. We now need donations from projects such as this to fund the ongoing operation of our donation and reuse center.

column1: Many thanks to the individuals and organizations who have already sponsored the start of this project, including: Burson's Seed &
column2: Feed, Cox Plumbing, Pineapple House, Lathan Technologies, SMI One, Systems and Methods, Inc., and Underground Books.  Thanks also to our partners Keep Carroll Beautiful and the Cultural Arts Center for their ongoing support.

Summary

I started painting about Three years ago but have been drawing all my life. I've been improving with every piece I've produced. I currently use acrylics but would like to get into oils. However they are expensive. I'm am know trying to work on people specifically with live models. I have a few volunteers but would like to use more professional models.
I'm looking to get a collection together that I can present at the Festival International Montréal en Arts and have a galley show locally.
Currently I don't have as much funds as I would like for supplies and the rent on my studio. As well I need to raise the funds to enter into the Festival.
What I Need
The funds will go towards supplies such as canvases, paint and brushes. as well as the monthly cost of my studio which is $200 a month.
As well I'm looking for live models. Models usually sit for 3-4 hours and cost $20-30/hour. The gallery space I'm looking at cost $175 for a month plus the fees for catering the opening.
And ultimately to get to FIMA http://www.festivaldesarts.org/index_eng.htm.
Which other than flight and hotel. (Which I'm saving up for) There is:
Registration: $270 for Emerging Artist.
which Includes:
10x10 tent
Promotion &
column2: program: name and booth number will appear in FIMA’s official program (20,000 free copies).

column1: WEB Promotion: a full page on FIMA’s Web site
Storage: $60
Table and Chairs: $30
Panels for Hanging Art: $60x2= $120
With you help I will be able to fulfil a dream I've had for a long while. And For your help you'll receive a special piece of my work done just for you!!
If you can't donate no problem just let others know and spread the word thanks!!!

CONCEPT
<div>
<ul>

• The Art Of Wore is a groundbreaking design company that specializes in original works of art expressly designed for printing on garments. We would love to commission some of todays hottest and in-demand artist's of all forms, to create an exclusive brand of High-End fashion.
Structure
<div>
<ul>
• The Art of Wore is a membership only platform that allows us give back to the Artist Bypassing the middle man. Using the money saved to more compensate the Artist.
<ul>
• Basic subscription - Basic design non limited prints.
<ul>
• Membership - Access to garments with limited prints.
<ul>
• Silver Membership - Access to garments with limited prints and option to add another garment for a flat rate. Copy of print included.
<ul>

• Gold Membership - Access to garments with limited prints and options to add another garment for a flat rate. Certificate of Authenticity with signature from artist. As an added bonus 1 Gold  member per month will be randomly selected  receive the Original of Art printed.
Prints
<ul>
<li>
The prints are always numbered and limited, a way to retain the value of the art and making it collectible.
<div>
<div>
<div class=""template asset"">
Members Vote on Art.
<div>

War of Art/ Art of Wore - Competition style  just  like In breakdancing we would battle through the art of dance.... it was visual, but not tangible.  In this secondary era of artistic battles..the art lives on digitally and through how connoisseur's decide to utilize the apparal, leaving in framed or framing their body.
What We Need

To bring Art of Wore  to reality we're missing a few major components. First and foremost is funding. If goals are met funding would go to commissioning artist, new equipment, building a new site. We have experimented  with several different type of printing methods.  Based on our research we found the printing method we would use most often especially  for really detailed multi colored paintings and drawings we would require us to upgrade our equipment. With the new equipment we would be able to print an exact replica of the Artwork submitted. Essentially we would be able to make it look like the Artist's painted/designed  right on the garments. We will also need to upgrade our website. We have a web Designer on standby ready to start developing  a  new version of Theartofwore.com.
Contributor Rewards
Limited Edition Contributor only Rewards
<div>
<div class=""template asset"">

Keep Calm and Carry On was a propaganda poster produced by the Government of the United Kingdom in 1939 during Second World War, intended to raise the morale. It had only limited distribution, So We loved the connection.
TWIST
<ul>

• There is an interesting twist on this story. We discovered a company that was Structured almost identical to TAOW. I did my research on  the company and found that it was formed by the same organization that legally formed Art Of Wore LLC 3 days after Art Of Wore was formed. I've tried professionally contacting the company but there was no response.  This really hit me hard I didn't what to think, it was a huge road block. I really  don't  if it just some crazy coincidence, But the fact of the matter is the similarities are undeniable.  We had to take some time and  strategize about what the best way to go about the situation. Indiegogo gives us the perfect opportunity to move forward with our vision. I think its the best and most positive way to tell the story.
Gas mask War of Art/Art of Wore V neck Mens
<div class=""template asset"">
War of Art/ Art of Wore Mens &
CHALLENGES

The story behind this project is extremely unique.  I am excited that we are here now. The learning experience that I got from that was incredible. Im sure  challenges are there just so unpredictable, but what I have been through with building this project I know that a challenge is nothing more than an opportunity to learn and to better the project and the company.
Our First Featured Artist's
Other Ways You Can Help
Please let your friends know on facebook, twitter, instagram. If your an Artist looking to be a part of The Art Of Wore please contact.

Yebo! ArtReach is a nonprofit organisation in the Kingdom of Swaziland. Founded in 2011 as an extension of Yebo! Art Gallery, we work together with local artists in running arts-related outreach projects and workshops. In 2012, ArtReach was registered as a separate NGO, primarily to address the lack of arts awareness and creative education in Swaziland.
Vision: A vibrant, creative and artistic Swaziland where the arts are both promoted as a necessary and relevant industry, and practiced as a unique tool for personal and social development
Mission: To promote the arts, innovative skills-training and creative freedom of expression in Swaziland through various grassroots initiatives and development work
Please visit
column2: >www.yeboswaziland.com to find out more about us.

column1: What We Need!

ArtReach is on the move! We have already accomplished a great deal in the 9 months that we have been operating. With enormous potential and an overwhelming response to our work, we are looking to expand our vision and capabilities into the new year.

In order to do this we need your help! We are looking to raise at least $6500 (approx. SZL 53,000) to begin our work in 2013. This amount is a starting point and will not cover our operations for the whole year, so any funds raised on top of this amount will definitely go a long way in reaching our goals!

ArtReach is currently working on a long-term project to begin intensive training programs with local artists and teachers. In the meantime, we are also looking to expand our continued outreach work in and around Swaziland. This is where you come in!
This Indiegogo campaign has two important aims:
<ol>
• Fundraising for the Art Goes Public project
<li>
Fundraising for School and Youth Centre Outreach work

column4: >

column2:
>
1. Art Goes Public – Promoting the arts in Swaziland: Transforming Spaces &

column1: ArtReach has developed a new project called Art Goes Public to address the strong need for engaging with the arts amongst the Swazi public as a whole. This dual-focused project will work towards bringing visual arts and spoken word poetry into the public sphere of Swaziland. ‘Art Goes Public’ will work with established local artists and poets to facilitate public mural/mosaic projects, and poetry workshops and performances. This project aims to use visual arts and spoken word in collaboration to create a platform for creative expression regarding relevant and contemporary artistic and social issues in Swaziland.

The project will be facilitated by ArtReach in collaboration with local organisations Yebo! Art Gallery and Rooted Soulz Poetry Collective. It will run for a pre-determined number of days each month between March-August 2013 in various locations around Swaziland. Please read the full Art Goes Public proposal for more info.

A minimum of $3000 is needed to begin this project. This will go towards the initial costs of: purchasing necessary materials, hosting artist’s planning meetings, paying artists, printing promotional arts materials and covering transport. Proper funding will then be sought to extend the project further into 2013.

column2:
>
2. ArtReach – Using the arts as a tool for personal development through selected outreach projects

column1: ArtReach aims to continue our art classes and creative skills workshops with teachers and students around Swaziland. Some of the places we will be visiting in 2013 are: The High School for the Deaf, Cheshire Homes for Disabled People, Juvenile Detention Centre, Women’s Correctional Services, and selected youth centres around the country.

We need to further our capacity to run the workshops and projects in these places - largely by acquiring art, craft and stationary supplies, as most of our recipients cannot afford to purchase their own. ArtReach needs more tools and equipment in order to run these projects and workshops, but we would also like to be able to leave the participants with materials in order to continue working after the projects. Additionally, we will use funds to pay our artists and volunteers for their assistance in support in planning and conducting workshops. Though these workshops will focus primarily on visual arts, we will also be incorporating spoken word poetry, clowning, theatre and dance where possible.
A minimum of $3000 is needed. This will go towards: purchasing necessary materials, paying artists and volunteers for their time, and covering transport costs.
Your Impact

Every Dollar/Euro/Pound/Rand goes a long way in Swaziland. By contributing to our fundraising campaign you are helping to develop ArtReach as an organisation, as well as ensuring that our work reaches as many individuals and groups as possible.

We are excited to keep you up to date with our growth and developments, and to welcome you as part of the ArtReach team! Please see our previous fundraising success on Indiegogo here and here, and we encourage you to explore more of our work on our website and Facebook page.

We are also offering a small selection of “perks” for all Indiegogo contributers!  These are items that we can offer to say thank you for your enthusiasm and support. Please see the full list of Perks on the right side of our page. . .

column2: >

column1: Background Information
The Kingdom of Swaziland

Swaziland is an amazing country with immense potential. It is, however, facing serious social, economic and political crises. Some of the issues currently facing Swaziland include youth unemployment of 53%, the breakdown of the traditional family unit, extreme HIV/AIDs statistics, financial crises, lack of proper education and resources, and growing social unrest. Over half of the population of Swaziland is now under the age of 18, and nearly a quarter are classified as ‘Orphaned and Vulnerable Children’ (OVC). For a tiny country with a small, homogonous population, these are all issues that will undoubtedly have dire consequences in the very near future.

These statistics may suggest rather bleak prospects for the average youth of Swaziland, but there are a number of positive initiatives addressing the various needs of the country. So how else can we begin to work towards strengthening the future of Swaziland? How can we help Swaziland realise it's full potential?

Whilst it is extremely important to address fundamental needs such as healthcare and access to food and water, it is also necessary to provide access to activities and people that stimulate innovative or creative thinking. This needs to be done in order to promote a stronger sense of individual or collective empowerment and awareness. It is extremely necessary to provide a platform through which Swazi youth (and adults) can express themselves freely in order to begin engaging in both internal and external dialogue. One of the best ways of doing this is through the arts – a sector that has, unfortunately, largely been neglected in Swaziland.
Why Art?

column2: title=""Artreach wall painting""/>Swaziland has the capacity and potential to be a vibrant, dynamic and creative country. In order to get to this level, we need to begin thinking about alternative solutions.

column1: Development is multi-faceted– when talking about personal or social development, we need to think more holistically, and begin thinking of ways in which we can empower the voices and spirits of a people, rather than just providing them with the bare essentials for survival. In order to do this, we need to begin building sustainable platforms for creativity and expression, as well as expose the general public to the arts in as many ways as possible.

What Swaziland needs is a conducive atmosphere for people to openly express themselves, and one that fosters creative thought processes. One of the best ways of achieving this is through sustained exposure to and involvement with the arts – an unparalleled means for developing strength, resiliency, and self-image that allows people to participate in society in a healthy way.  In the last decades, a significant body of research and practice has emerged, demonstrating that sustained involvement in the arts provides significant benefits, particularly for the youth. Harnessing creativity sparks a process of imagination and belief, encouraging creative thinking and problem solving: important traits that are then applied to all facets of one’s life – work, relationships, family, school, etc.

Art provides a holistic, “bigger picture” interpretation of life, and may be seen as embodying the end goal of any human development initiative: the cultivation of mental and physical health, worth and expression. For this reason, it is important to address promotion of the arts and creative thought and expression for all people in this country, bringing these to as wide an audience as possible.
How else can you help?
Other than trying to raise funds, any extra donations of time (volunteering, promoting, etc), materials (art and craft supplies) or resources (books, magazines, movies, etc) are greatly appreciated.
Are you a manufacturer of art supplies? Do you have access to donated or second hand material? Are you part of a group or collective that could gather together to donate material?

We are always looking for any of the following: Arts Materials (sketch pads, paints, pens, pencils, canvases, brushes, etc.), Crafts Materials (stationary, designs, etc), Books (classroom books, art reference books, magazines, etc) &
Thank You!
Siyabonga Kakhulu!

","Yebo! ArtReach is a nonprofit organisation in the Kingdom of Swaziland. Founded in 2011 as an extension of Yebo! Art Gallery, we work together with local artists in running arts-related outreach projects and workshops. In 2012, ArtReach was registered as a separate NGO, primarily to address the lack of arts awareness and creative education in Swaziland.
Vision: A vibrant, creative and artistic Swaziland where the arts are both promoted as a necessary and relevant industry, and practiced as a unique tool for personal and social development
Mission: To promote the arts, innovative skills-training and creative freedom of expression in Swaziland through various grassroots initiatives and development work
Please visit www.yeboswaziland.com to find out more about us.
What We Need!

ArtReach is on the move! We have already accomplished a great deal in the 9 months that we have been operating. With enormous potential and an overwhelming response to our work, we are looking to expand our vision and capabilities into the new year.

In order to do this we need your help! We are looking to raise at least $6500 (approx. SZL 53,000) to begin our work in 2013. This amount is a starting point and will not cover our operations for the whole year, so any funds raised on top of this amount will definitely go a long way in reaching our goals!

ArtReach is currently working on a long-term project to begin intensive training programs with local artists and teachers. In the meantime, we are also looking to expand our continued outreach work in and around Swaziland. This is where you come in!
This Indiegogo campaign has two important aims:
Fundraising for the Art Goes Public project
Fundraising for School and Youth Centre Outreach work
1. Art Goes Public – Promoting the arts in Swaziland: Transforming Spaces & Empowering Voices

ArtReach has developed a new project called Art Goes Public to address the strong need for engaging with the arts amongst the Swazi public as a whole. This dual-focused project will work towards bringing visual arts and spoken word poetry into the public sphere of Swaziland. ‘Art Goes Public’ will work with established local artists and poets to facilitate public mural/mosaic projects, and poetry workshops and performances. This project aims to use visual arts and spoken word in collaboration to create a platform for creative expression regarding relevant and contemporary artistic and social issues in Swaziland.

The project will be facilitated by ArtReach in collaboration with local organisations Yebo! Art Gallery and Rooted Soulz Poetry Collective. It will run for a pre-determined number of days each month between March-August 2013 in various locations around Swaziland. Please read the full Art Goes Public proposal for more info.

A minimum of $3000 is needed to begin this project. This will go towards the initial costs of: purchasing necessary materials, hosting artist’s planning meetings, paying artists, printing promotional arts materials and covering transport. Proper funding will then be sought to extend the project further into 2013.
2. ArtReach – Using the arts as a tool for personal development through selected outreach projects

ArtReach aims to continue our art classes and creative skills workshops with teachers and students around Swaziland. Some of the places we will be visiting in 2013 are: The High School for the Deaf, Cheshire Homes for Disabled People, Juvenile Detention Centre, Women’s Correctional Services, and selected youth centres around the country.

We need to further our capacity to run the workshops and projects in these places - largely by acquiring art, craft and stationary supplies, as most of our recipients cannot afford to purchase their own. ArtReach needs more tools and equipment in order to run these projects and workshops, but we would also like to be able to leave the participants with materials in order to continue working after the projects. Additionally, we will use funds to pay our artists and volunteers for their assistance in support in planning and conducting workshops. Though these workshops will focus primarily on visual arts, we will also be incorporating spoken word poetry, clowning, theatre and dance where possible.
A minimum of $3000 is needed. This will go towards: purchasing necessary materials, paying artists and volunteers for their time, and covering transport costs.
Your Impact

Every Dollar/Euro/Pound/Rand goes a long way in Swaziland. By contributing to our fundraising campaign you are helping to develop ArtReach as an organisation, as well as ensuring that our work reaches as many individuals and groups as possible.

We are excited to keep you up to date with our growth and developments, and to welcome you as part of the ArtReach team! Please see our previous fundraising success on Indiegogo here and here, and we encourage you to explore more of our work on our website and Facebook page.

We are also offering a small selection of “perks” for all Indiegogo contributers!  These are items that we can offer to say thank you for your enthusiasm and support. Please see the full list of Perks on the right side of our page. . .

RECENT INJUSTICE NEWS:  The Drugging and Rape of Susan Hunter
http://injusticewillbeserved.blogspot.com/?m=1
<h3><em>""Don't change a thing! It has to be the way it is. My name, the rape, the details of the rape, the suicide attempt
column2: all of it is linked. If you take out or change one part, the whole thing becomes unraveled. Let the people know what happened. Suicide is nothing to be ashamed of either… I am not ashamed of myself or what I have been through. And to be ashamed or hide myself from my own story only gives them something to hold above me. OK?... I didn't fail the system, the system failed me.""  Susan Hunter

column1: Calj's Honor Release Project is passionate about publishing / distributing a tribute book that will include an array of local and national artists displaying their best work while discussing ideal ways to fight the various levels of injustice.

This is Calj's Honor Release Project's NOVELTY ART GALLERY new video promotion to support the National Awareness Drive against INJUSTICE of ALL Kinds that often results in violations of rights, horrific abuses and LOSS OF LIFE!

Rapidly eroding are our rights as a people.  Every aspect of freedom and civil liberty is under assault stemming from government intrusions, police misconduct, unfair laws, media / social bias, wrongful convictions, violent outburst and unfortunately murder of defenseless citizens.

We believe in standing for something and this is our passion! Hundred of thousands are affected by some form of injustice, many too close to home, some too close for comfort.  It's a cause for ALL and ALL for a cause. Get behind us on this and let us POWER justice across this nation and the world for ALL!
*GREAT CONTRIBUTION ""PERKS"" TO THE RIGHT*
In a effort to continue funding this national campaign as well as publish a tribute periodical, Calj's Honor Release Project is hoping to raise $8000 in a very short time.

This money will be used also to generate brochures, leaflets, posters, social ad campaigns in addition to publishing a recognition periodical that will include tributes to local and national artists, enlisting their ideas on how we can IGNITE freedom from INJUSTICE through ART.  We'd LOVE to go beyond this amount!

As an appreciation for supporting this National Awareness Drive, those persons contributing through the purchase of print products and / or donation will receive themed tote bags as well as complimentary gifts from businesses supporting this project.
*GREAT CONTRIBUTION ""PERKS"" TO THE RIGHT*
This is a REACHABLE goal.  Not everyone can do everything.  But everyone can do something.
<div>
Choose your desired contribution range to the right of the page and KNOW that you are doing your part!  Please invite others to do the same!
Lastly, be sure to visit Calj's Honor Release Project's website (www.chrprecruitcon.com) to purchase print products based on those beautiful pieces of art!
Thank YOU!!!

Augustus Charles (Calj)

Our Story
New England has a great Art Scene, and Portland has a great Array of Galleries.
column4: >  However most of these galleries are only looking to display commercial works. This leaves lots of the less conventional artists without an outlet.

column1: The goal of this Art Show is to help get more of the local artists who can't get their work in galleries, or who at least never even thought they had a chance, out there and to get people to look at their work. To appreciate it despite or perhaps for its non conventional ways.
The Impact

This show will help many New England artists gain exposure and present their work to people they couldn't reach without this event. It will also hopefully give the Portland audience an introduction to art and ideas they wouldn't normally be presented with.
<h3>What We Need &amp

The $2000 will go towards securing a venue(Insurance fees, Permit fees if it's held on public property,Security deposits, and application fees if held on public property), helping to fund participating artists, paying the bands that come to play, advertising, and renting any necessary equipment(PA, Generator, Tents, Stage)
Other Ways You Can Help

You can tell all your friends, make us flyers. Show them to us and we'll probably print them up and put em around. Or just put them up yourself wherever you are. Or do both, whatever floats your boat. The more people that hear about it, the more funding we'll have, the more artists we can show, and the more people will come.
Also you can come to the show, you can have art in the show, you can run around waving your arms and screaming about the show. Just help us get people there.
If you do want to have art in the show and you're a New England Artist, or if you have any questions, send an E-Mail to EvanTGilbert@gmail.com.
","Our Story

New England has a great Art Scene, and Portland has a great Array of Galleries.  However most of these galleries are only looking to display commercial works. This leaves lots of the less conventional artists without an outlet.

The goal of this Art Show is to help get more of the local artists who can't get their work in galleries, or who at least never even thought they had a chance, out there and to get people to look at their work. To appreciate it despite or perhaps for its non conventional ways.
The Impact

This show will help many New England artists gain exposure and present their work to people they couldn't reach without this event. It will also hopefully give the Portland audience an introduction to art and ideas they wouldn't normally be presented with.
What We Need & What You Get

The $2000 will go towards securing a venue(Insurance fees, Permit fees if it's held on public property,Security deposits, and application fees if held on public property), helping to fund participating artists, paying the bands that come to play, advertising, and renting any necessary equipment(PA, Generator, Tents, Stage)
Other Ways You Can Help

You can tell all your friends, make us flyers. Show them to us and we'll probably print them up and put em around. Or just put them up yourself wherever you are. Or do both, whatever floats your boat. The more people that hear about it, the more funding we'll have, the more artists we can show, and the more people will come.
Also you can come to the show, you can have art in the show, you can run around waving your arms and screaming about the show. Just help us get people there.
If you do want to have art in the show and you're a New England Artist, or if you have any questions, send an E-Mail to EvanTGilbert@gmail.com.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Portland, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/new-england-independent-art-show/pica

Our Story

column3: >Founded in 2006, Sinner Saint Burlesque produces Seattle's longest continually running weekly burlesque show, featuring 8 week long themed runs and guest appearances by international burlesque sensations! Our troupe is composed of 5 members: Evilyn Sin Claire, Jesse Belle-Jones, Lady Tatas, Polly Wood, and Dona Dei Cuori The seasoned professionals of SSB also manage an internship program within the troupe providing educational and performance opportunities for young performers. Reaching new levels of success, and evolving significantly as a troupe, our current branding does not adequately reflect the development the troupe has taken over the last 5 years, or our current strategic goals. We recently began performing internationally, and have increased our traveling and performances within North America. We need a cohesive and engaging marketing package that represents our current values and identity to present to potential producers, sponsors, venues, and shows.

column1: The Impact

We've begun the process of birthing our new public identity already, so if we don't get funded, it means we take that money out of our own pockets. Which means we will be much less sparkly when you come see us! :(
<h3>What We Need &amp

The funds will cover several areas: The funds raised would go towards logo redesign, fliers, posters, website redesign, city/state business registration and licensing, trademarking fees and any associated TM lawyer fees.
Here's what we can offer you in thanks for your generous support:

$5 – Signed flier 
$10 – Hair flower 
$25 – Signed 8x10 
$50 – 2 tickets to a SSB show 
$100 – 2 tickets for each 8 week run that SSB produces for 1 year 
$300 – Party package at a SSB show 
$500 – Performance at a private party
Other Ways You Can Help
Help us spread the word: If you know friends who are fans of SSB, encourage them to contribute!
Match donations: If you have the capacity, and are interested in being a matching donor, please let us know!
Come to our show! Every Thursday night, 9:30 at the Noc Noc!
www.sinnersaintburlesque.com

Hello there my name is Jay Neilson and I am an independent illustrator in Ontario, Canada.
My focus creatively has always been music
column2: whether writing, performing or producing it. I go under the name Johnny Confidence (feel free to check out itunes/youtube)

column1: But music is not the only thing I love.

See, I've doodled and drawn since I was a little kid,
never pursuing it or giving it a chance due to my musical pursuits.
But lately I've been thinking things through and wanted to put together a book of illustrated animals w instruments
column2:
from A to Z.

It's a simple concept
column3:
an animal for every letter of the alphabet.
That animal will be playing an instrument also starting with the letter.

column1: Example
column2:
""Anteater on an accordian"" and so on.
(I also will be writing a descriptive paragraph for each drawing on the opposite page).

I know it sounds silly but if you saw the 2 images from the book that I've worked on so far you'll see the style I'm going for and feel compelled to help out.

I do the lionshare of the work so I won't have any massive costs.
I WILL need to use proper equipment for scanning and editting.

column1:
My style is pencil and black ink. I may or may not choose colors for each panel.
Maybe you can give me feedback on that.

I will mostly need funding to get the book printed, set up and published though.

That is where you come in.
Below are my set entry levels for funding my project and the numerous perks that are available to you, the funder!

In a world where everything is done by machine or computer (including our tv shows and movies!) I really hope to get a lot more of these projects off the ground.

I have many more ideas I would love to pursue with your help.

But really, funding is just the very first way you can help,
it would be amazing if you could share this page on your
Twitter, your Facebook, etc.

ALSO, for more images and art just click the ""website"" link.

Our Story
Help me throw the birthday party of the Year of the Apocalypse, space alien boom-boom style!

For the longest time I've been itching to get the coolest, brightest and most chill people I know together for a night of good times in an ultra safe, ultra stimulating environment for free. What better way to celebrate my life thus far than with the people who impact it the most!
This event is, for me, not just a birthday party
column2: it's an opportunity for me to love the people I love with music, libations and tons of stimulating art and experiences. I made this Indiegogo campaign to 1. raise awareness of the event and 2. allow the people who will participate at the party an opportunity to help make this event epic!

column1: <div style="""">
The Impact

Let's be honest: if we don't raise the money, it's not like the party isn't going to be awesome. It'll just mean that I will have to foot the entire bill. And I would prefer not to! We're keeping the party Free-99 and to offset the expenses of having a free party we need you.  So, 5 or 10 buckaroonies from you would be awesome-sauce.
By the by, the party is going down on:
