column3:
> 

We are the same crazy Russians who brought a banya (a very hot place) to the playa (yet another superhot place) last year to make you sweat in the best way possible. Last year we had 600 happy burners who enjoyed the mysteries of steam (find more here). And a huge, huge line of those, who wanted it but we ran out of capacity.

          

So we are back to the Playa again to bring it to more, more Black Rock citizens. More burners will experience the magic of steam, will learn the art and science of transformation.

More burners will deep dive into the very centre of their existence, in the process we learned to guide people through. 1500 people, that’s how many burners will be with us this time. I 6:45, that’s where it magic happens.

To make that happen, we need to expand the camp:

column1: <li>Two 15ft dome-shaped steamrooms, operating day and night
column2: one giant swing, a huge tripod and a massive tea lounge

column1: • 15 steammasters
• Cold-water station
• Herbs, branches, samovar
• Russian soul, ancesters’ spirits, your sincerety and openness

We were so unhappy to refuse access due to overbooking, that's why we made the second steamroom happen. The new steamroom will be extraordinary. We call it 'The Onion', it's a 15ft metal structure resembling an onion or a tulip bulb. It has a wooden interior and therefore recreates a traditional banya environment. Both steamrooms will operate together so that 20-25 burners will enjoy the banya session simultaneously. This amounts to over 200 people a day, more than twice as much as last year.  Follow us here to stay updated: https://www.facebook.com/banyahelaerslab/
column2:
>WE REALLY NEED YOU!

Let’s join the forces. We have built and shipped all the steamrooms already, but we still need to match the budget for all the new stuff we are completing now: it’s 15k USD and here we are.

And please trust us, the perks we selected for you are unparalleled. Completely.
column3: >Support us, come to join us to Inspirit &amp
column4: 6:15 and let the steam be with you!
column5:
>

> 

La pièce en quelques mots

Un manoir obscur et fascinant, dans une cité hors du temps. Celui qu’on appelle l’Ogre attire à lui des proies presque consentantes pour les aimer puis les tuer. Mais d’où viennent ces femmes ? Pourquoi se donnent-elles à lui ? Elles le racontent dans les carnets qu’elles laissent derrière elles et que Féléor assemble en un curieux livre – ses Sangs.
Mercredi, Constance, Abigaëlle, Frida, Phélie, Lottä, Marie : sept femmes, et autant d’expériences du désir et de la mort, sept écritures qui disent la féminité, le narcissisme, la soumission tantôt feinte, tantôt amusée. (Éditions Grasset, 2015)

Notre projet

En octobre dernier, Le Bain Public  a reçu une invitation tout droit venue du Mexique. Les Sangs a été sélectionné pour la 25e édition du Festival International de Théâtre Universitaire à Mexico qui se tiendra du 10 au 18 février 2018.

Il s’agit d’une occasion en or pour toute l’équipe de non seulement rencontrer un milieu culturel différent du notre, mais de développer des contacts auprès d’artistes émergents, de communauté établie à Mexico et du monde entier. En plus d’expérimenter de nouvelle avenue, notre production contribue au rayonnement du Québec, de la scène montréalaise sur la scène culturelle internationale. 

Pour ce faire, nous devons défrayer les coûts de billets d’avion, d'assurances voyages et dépenses personnelles pour notre équipe qui compte 12 membres. 

 

Qui part pour Mexico?
Acteurs/actrices : Anneke Brier, Ariel Antonacci, Michaël Bédard, Lauriane Chioini, Maude Demers-Rivard, Marianne Lamarche, Maxime Stabili.

Concepteurs/conceptrices : Tommy Bourassa, Camila Forteza, Geneviève Gagné, Anne-Marie Hivert, Catherine Ménard-Jolin.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Welcome To The Black Sabbath

After several months of hard work, the Devilman Tarot Project team is pleased to announce that our finished deck, Tarot of the Black Sabbath, is finally available for preordering! All of our mods and contributors have put their hearts and souls into making this project a reality, and only a few of us had to merge with demons to make it possible.
A Terrible Fate Awaits You...
...Or maybe a really great one! That's what these cards are for, after all. But while we can't change your future, we can guarantee at least one good thing will happen if your preorder!

The deck itself contains 78 cards, and comes inside its own tuck-box for convenient storage or display. It also comes with a small guide booklet containing all of the card meanings and artist credits!
We've provided a few different options for preordering, and so long as you donate $10 or more, you can get yourself some of our cool merch! Depending on what you select, this includes:
<ul>
• The full 78 card deck
• A collaborative sticker sheet featuring several characters from the series
• Button badges
• Acrylic charms
• Enamel pins
• And postcards, featuring printed artwork

Additionally, everyone who preorders will receive an exclusive glow-in-the-dark Tako charm, regardless of which perk they choose. The first 10 people who preorder either merch bundle will also receive a limited edition Devilman bunny charm! (Be sure to select the ""Limited Edition"" version when choosing your perk if you want to claim yours!)
<h3>Goals, Risks, &amp

In order to fully fund production of the deck and other merchandise, we're asking for a total of $6000. This may seem like a lot, but we want to be sure that we are able to deliver a quality product to all of our customers, and that all of our contributors are properly compensated.
The good news? If we reach even half of our total goal, everyone who preordered will still get their copy of the deck, plus their preorder bonus items!

The not-so-good news? Most of our items are unable to be produced until after certain funding goals are met, so if we don't hit our target, we may have to cut back on some of the merch included in the bundles, or downgrade more expensive items, such as changing the enamel pin to an acrylic one.
But we are optimistic, and will do what we can with whatever funding we receive!
Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount you can contribute will be beneficial, but if you can't donate, then you can help spread the word by telling your friends or posting about us on Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, or whatever social media site you use!

WHAT IS WUSSY MAG?

WUSSY is an Atlanta-based publication that produces original content which encourages the discussion of life, politics, art, and expression from the perspective of the Southern LGBTQ+ community. In the works since 2012, WUSSY has garnered a dedicated following of readers who look to us for a curated, singular, queer-centric point-of-view.

In March 2017, we will launch WUSSY Rag - a biweekly print edition that will be distributed all over the city of Atlanta. Our own alt-weekly will include the same biting social and political commentary you’ve come to expect from us.
WHAT WE WILL OFFER
- WUSSY HQ/Office Space
- Photo/Video/Recording Studio
- Dance, Yoga, and Body Classes
- Workshops and Community Outreach
- Performance Art Space
- Gallery Space
- Comfortable/Creative space to work!
WHERE YOUR DONATIONS GO
Right now we are working with a 2800 sq. ft blank slate of queer potential.

$25,000 is a lofty goal, but it is roughly the cost of one-year's rent in the fabulous new space. After we make sure everything is safe, accessible, and clean, we will focus on filling the space with amenities for you and your projects. Your donations will go directly towards the cost of insurance, building materials, lighting &
column2: studio equipment, tables, chairs, signage, and general operating expenses.

column1:
Having this space will allow us to push the boundaries of our work and your donation will help us further address the needs of the Atlanta Queer community and its wide spectrum of beautiful people.

Project overview

The goal of the Theremin-X project is simple: hook a theremin up to a bunch of vibrators and make a video of the setup being used. I really want to make sure this project is done well, and for that I need your help.

I envision the video being like a surreal concert. It will explore concepts such as mapping between senses—in this case between music and sexual stimulation—as well as the performer-audience relationship. I also hope the video will be strangely beautiful and moving, even if its basic premise is rather absurd.

To make sure these points come across, I plan to hire a professional theremin player and people who will make sure the video is filmed and recorded well. This means that the project will be more expensive to realize than any of my previous work. I believe it will be worth it though. If nothing else, it should certainly be a little different.

Project vision
A faint sound echos down the unfamiliar corridors. Almost like the wind, calling. You obey.

Louder, yet still unplaceable. One moment like some great generator starting up, the next like an opera singer heard through the floorboards. And there is something else too. Faint mumblings. Definitely human. Part of you wants to turn back but you're so close now. Through that cracked door just up ahead. With infinite caution, you peer in.

At the center of the chamber stands a man silhouetted by a spotlight. The air reverberates with etherial sound. He stands almost motionless, arms outstretched over a mysterious wooden box with two antennas springing from its sides. Only his hands move, gently yet commandingly, as if tracing out some infinitely intricate design in the air. You cannot look away. As his motions become quicker, the sound grows deeper and more profound.
Just as the music reaches a crescendo, a groan echoes out. Your heart races. Who else is there? The man continues playing unfazed.

How had you not noticed them before? The three figures reclining around the edge of the room. But they have not seen you. They look only at him, enraptured. Bodies contorting with every change in the music, with every subtle hand motion. Faces expressing pure bliss. And, in this moment, you want nothing more than to join them...
*Fade to white*
Voiceover: Thermin-X, the new scent from Lalph Rauren.

What will be created

The main product will be the video. I'm hoping we can record two to three songs. The video will be released online so that anyone can watch it. It will not be monetized in any way.

I also hope to document the production process and provide regular updates. I don't want to spoil all the details but will provide general information about what we've accomplished and what remains to be done.

What funding will be used for
• Hiring a professional theremin player.
• Hiring members of the audience. Targeting three professional models here who will be able to present the experience well on film.
• Hiring people to film and record the whole thing.
• Renting out a fun location for filming.
• Getting additional vibrators.
• Getting equipment required to convert the signal from a pro theremin to midi.

If we don't meet the goal, I hope to still be able to realize the project with a smaller scope. Any funds raised would go towards this. 

What's already been done

Work has already started!
• Prototyped basic theremin vibrator setup. This is briefly demonstrated in the video.
• In talks with professional theremin player.
• Also talking with company to coordinate filming.

How you can help

Besides donating, there are plenty of ways to help out:
• Be a Theremin-X evangelist. Tell people who would appreciate it about the Theremin-X Project.
• Have a great idea for the video or an idea for a similar project? Let me know! I'd be happy to offer advice or help out
• Inspired? Build your own musical sex organ! The possibilities are endless

About me

Hi! I'm Matt Bierner. For a guy pitching a theremin sex video I'm really not as strange as you make hope.

I guess the best way to describe me is a 'maker'. I like creating things, either with code or with my hands. You can checkout some of what work on over on my website. Much of it is lighthearted, while also exploring topics and ideas that I think are interesting and important.

The Theremin-X project comes from my experiments in 'modded reality', which has looked at using technology to rework and remix your sensory experience of the world. This has involved everything from using VR goggles to experience life in the third person, to translating colors into sexual stimulation. I find it interesting to think about technologies role in sexual expression.

This project draws on my previous work and was specifically inspired by some synesthetic experiences. Originally, I envisioned a DJ controlling the vibrators, but after thinking about it more, a theremin really seemed like the perfect fit. It's a beautiful instrument, etherial yet unmistakably electronic sounding with a playing style that resembles conducting. Its history as one of the first electronic instruments and the manner in which it produces sound (oscillators) also seemed like a nice tie in with vibrators. I've even been trying to learn how to play the Theremin myself 

I don't claim to be the most qualified person to make the Theremin-X project happen, but I may be the only person who will make it happen. This is also a project I really just want to see made. The whole theremin sex thing is some rather silly fun sure, but I really do feel this piece explores some important concepts and I hope that the resulting video will be beautiful in its own strange way. 

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me.

column3: >[Version FRANÇAISE après la version anglaise / Wersja POLSKA znajduje się na końcu]
column7: >We created our brand, combining artistic, hand-painted designs with precious silk, in order to offer beautiful luxury scarves. Each of our collections is limited to a small number of pieces in order to guarantee the exclusivity and uniqueness of our creations.
column8: >Colours play a vital role in our everyday life. In this first collection, we tried to play with bold combinations, providing you with a daily touch of colour, matching with elegant and casual cloths. More than a simple accessory, a silk scarf is like a jewel instantly transforming your outfit.
column11: >To develop our first collection, we were working with crasftsmen of excellence, from pattern making to silk printing and finishing, with care for every detail. Our mission was to create feminine, elegant and modern pieces of high quality and  high artistic value. We realised prototypes in 3 different countries, comparing the quality and colour rendering. We tested different types of silk to identify the combination of characteristics matching our philosophy of luxury scarf for daily use.
column12: >We chose silk twill, because of its rich texture with fluid drape and delicate sparkle. Twill tends to keep its shape, compared to silk satin, easily wrinkled.
column16: >Our scarves are crafted in the north of Italy, region of Como. It has ideal conditions to produce silk, due to its abundance of mulberry trees and crystal clear waters.  For more than 500 years, silk manufacturing in Como has been a worldwide symbol of quality, prestige and refinement.
column19: >100 % OF COLOURS INSPIRED BY NATURE
column20: >For our first collection, we selected three leading colours, directly inspired by nature:

>The combinations of colours are eye-catching and harmonious, flattering and adding a special glow to the face.
column7: >For each pattern, Weronika (expert in botanical art) painted a rich ""vocabulary"" of floral shapes, carefully observing their anatomy. Each element is unique.

column18: >Today we have two new designs, ready to be launched, and we are working on new patterns inspired by different colours and plants. During this campaign you can pre-order some of our new models with delivery from January 2021.
column19: >EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / limited to 5 first sales (retail price: 175 €)
column20: >INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (retail price: 175 €)
column21: >EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / limited to 5 first sales (retail price: 175 €)
column24: >BEHIND OUR CREATIONS
column26: >Thank you for your time and interest in our project!
column31: >You can discover more at:
column46: >Nous avons créé notre marque en combinant nos designs peints à la main avec de la soie précieuse afin d’offrir de magnifiques foulards haut de gamme. Chacune de nos collections est limitée à un petit nombre d’exemplaires afin de garantir la qualité et l’originalité de nos créations.
column47: >Les couleurs jouent un rôle vitale au quotidien. Dans cette première collection, nous avons essayé de jouer avec des combinaisons ambitieuses, apportant une touche de couleur compatible aussi bien avec des tenues élégantes qu’avec des ensembles décontractés. Plus qu’un simple accessoire, un foulard en soie peut, tel un bijou, transformer joliment une silhouette.
column50: >Pour développer notre première collection, nous avons travaillé avec des artisans d’excellence, de la création du motif, à l’impression de la soie jusqu’aux dernières finitions. Tout cela avec le plus grand souci du détails. Notre mission fut de créer des pièces féminines, élégantes et modernes de grande qualité dont la valeur artistique est préservée. Nous avons réalisé des prototypes dans 3 pays différents, comparant la qualité et le rendu des couleurs. Nous avons testé différent type de soie pour identifier la matière la plus en phase abbé notre idée de foulard haut de gamme pour un usage au quotidien.
column51: >Nous avons choisi le twill de soie grâce à sa texture riche, fluide et sans brillance délicate. Le twill garde sa forme à comparer au satin qui se froisse facilement.
column55: >Nos foulards sont fabriqué dans le nord de l’Italie dans la région de Côme. Nous avons fait ce choix car cette région dispose des conditions idéales pour produire la soie grâce à l’abondance des arbres de Mulberry et la qualité de ses eaux pures. Pendant plus de 500 ans, la production de soie de Côme dispose d’une réputation de qualité, de prestige et de raffinement.
column58: >100 % DES COULEURS INSPIRÉS PAR LA NATURE
column59: >Pour notre première collection, nous avons sélectionné 3 couleurs principales, directement inspirées par la nature:

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >ORANGE turmeric exprimant la joie et le bonheur

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >VERT verdian souvent lié à l’équilibre et la confiance en soi.
>Ces combinaisons de couleurs attirent le regard tout en étant délicate et embellissent le visage en y reflétant un trait de couleurs souvent bénéfiques pour le teint.
column5: >Pour chaque motif, Weronika (expert en art botanique) a peint un « vocabulaire » de silhouette florale, en observant méticuleusement leur anatomie. Chaque élément est unique.
column9: >En attendant le lancement de notre magasin online, vous pouvez toujours
column10: > commande nos étoffes en soie via cette plateforme et de profiter des prix de lancement.
column17: >Aujourd’hui, nous avons deux nouveaux designs, prêts au lancement. Nous travaillons, par ailleurs, sur de nouveaux motifs inspirés par des des plantes et des couleurs différentes. Lors de cette campagne, vous pouvez pré-commandez certains de nos nouveaux modèles avec une livraison attendue mi-Janvier 2021.

column24: >Weronika Anna Rosa est peintre et designer d'origine polonaise, residente à Lisbonne. Elle détient égallement un master en Histoire de l'Art.  Weronika est fascinée par la nature, en particulier par le monde de flore avec sa varieté des couleurs, forms et textures.
column26: >Merci encore pour votre temps et votre intérêt envers notre projet!
column38: >@weronikaanna_rosa (création artistique personnelle)
column40: >@silk_by_weronikarosa (foulards en soie)
column47: >Nasza marka została stworzona z zamiłowania do pięknych przedmiotów. Łączymy w niej ręcznie malowane projekty ze szlachetnym jedwabiem, oferując luksusowe szale o wysokim walorze artystycznym. Każda z naszych kolekcji jest realizowana w ramach limitowanych edycji w celu zapewnienia wyjątkowości i unikatowości naszych kreacji.
column48: >Kolory odgrywają niezwykle istotną rolę w naszym życiu codziennym. W ramach naszej pierwszej kolekcji, proponujemy odważne kombinacje barwne, do noszenia na codzień, pasujące do eleganckich i niezobowiązujących ubrań. Jedwabny szal jest czymś więcej niż zwykłym dodatkiem, jest niczym biżuteria, która natychmiast odmieni Twój strój.
column51: >Rozwijając naszą pierwszą kolekcję, współpracowaliśmy z doskonałymi rzemieślnikami, specjalizującymi się w druku na jedwabiu i wykończeniach tego cennego materiału, z dbałością o każdy szczegół. Naszą misją było stworzenie kobiecych, eleganckich i nowoczesnych dodatków o najwyższej jakości.
column52: >W tym celu, zrealizowaliśmy prototypy w 3 różnych krajach, porównując jakość i wierność kolorów. Przetestowaliśmy różne rodzaje jedwabiu i wybraliśmy jedwab typu Twill ze względu na jego bogatą teksturę, pięknie układające się fałdy i delikatny połysk. Twill nie gniecie się tak łatwo jak satyna jedwabna, co zapewnia mu nienaganny wygląd nawet po całodniowym noszeniu.
column56: >Nasze szale są wykonywane na północy Włoch, w regionie Como. Ze względu na bogactwo drzew morwowych i krystalicznie czystą wodę, region ten posiada idealne warunki do produkcji jedwabiu. Od ponad 500 lat jedwabne tkaniny z Como są światowym symbolem jakości, prestiżu i wyrafinowania.
column60: >W ramach naszej pierwszej kolekcji wybraliśmy trzy główne kolory, bezpośrednio zainspirowane naturą:

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >pomarańcz kurkumy ""turmeric ORANGE"" wyrażająca radość i szczęcie

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >czerwień karminową ""carmin RED"" dająca witalność i energię

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >szmaragdowa zieleń ""verdian GREEN"" często kojarzona z dobrą równowagą pewnością siebie.
>Harmonijne kompozycje kolorystyczne przyciągają wzrok, a barwy barwy delikatnie rozświetlone przez jedwabną tkaninę dodają twarzy szczególnego blasku i korzystnego wyglądu.
column7: >Dla każdego ze wzorów Weronika (specjalizująca się w sztuce botanicznej) namalowała bogate ""abecadło"" form kwiatowych, splecionych w organicznych kompozycjach. Podobnie jak w naturze, tak i na naszych chustach, każdy element jest unikatowy i nie występują powtórzenia.
column9:
>LIMITOWANA EDYCJA

Oczekując na otwarcie naszego sklepu online, możecie wciąż  zamówić nasze jedwabne chusty poprzez tą platformę i skorzystać z korzystniejszych cen.
column15: >Dziś posiadamy dwa nowe projekty, przetestowane i gotowe do wprowadzenia, oraz pracujemy nad nowymi wzorami. Pomysłów nam nie brakuje! W ramach tej kampanii możesz zamówić nasze dwa nowe modele, z dostawą przewidzianą na połowę stycznia 2021 r.
column16: >EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / jedynie dla 5 pierwszych zamówień (cena rynkowa: 175 €)
column18: >EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / jedynie dla 5 pierwszych zamówień (cena rynkowa: 175 €)
column22: >Weronika Anna Rosa, malarka i projektantka polskiego pochodzenia, obecnie mieszkająca w Lizbonie. Z wykształcenia historyczka sztuki, Weronika czerpie inspiracje ze świata roślin, który stanowi niewyczerpalny repertuar form, kolorów i tekstur.
column27: >Dziękujemy za poświęcony czas i zainteresowanie naszym projektem!

","[Version FRANÇAISE après la version anglaise / Wersja POLSKA znajduje się na końcu] THE IDEAWe created our brand, combining artistic, hand-painted designs with precious silk, in order to offer beautiful luxury scarves. Each of our collections is limited to a small number of pieces in order to guarantee the exclusivity and uniqueness of our creations. Colours play a vital role in our everyday life. In this first collection, we tried to play with bold combinations, providing you with a daily touch of colour, matching with elegant and casual cloths. More than a simple accessory, a silk scarf is like a jewel instantly transforming your outfit. QUALITY IS OUR PRIORITYTo develop our first collection, we were working with crasftsmen of excellence, from pattern making to silk printing and finishing, with care for every detail. Our mission was to create feminine, elegant and modern pieces of high quality and  high artistic value. We realised prototypes in 3 different countries, comparing the quality and colour rendering. We tested different types of silk to identify the combination of characteristics matching our philosophy of luxury scarf for daily use. We chose silk twill, because of its rich texture with fluid drape and delicate sparkle. Twill tends to keep its shape, compared to silk satin, easily wrinkled. EUROPEAN TRADITIONS & SAVOIR-FAIREOur scarves are crafted in the north of Italy, region of Como. It has ideal conditions to produce silk, due to its abundance of mulberry trees and crystal clear waters.  For more than 500 years, silk manufacturing in Como has been a worldwide symbol of quality, prestige and refinement.100 % OF COLOURS INSPIRED BY NATUREFor our first collection, we selected three leading colours, directly inspired by nature:

column1: turmeric ORANGE expressing joy and happiness
carmin RED bringing dynamic forces and energy
verdian GREEN often linked to good balance and self-confidence.

The combinations of colours are eye-catching and harmonious, flattering and adding a special glow to the face. BOTANICAL INSPIRATIONSFor each pattern, Weronika (expert in botanical art) painted a rich ""vocabulary"" of floral shapes, carefully observing their anatomy. Each element is unique.LIMITED COLLECTION Before we launch our online store, you can still order our silk scarves via this platform and take advantage of the reduced prices.INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (retail price: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (retail price: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (retail price: 175 €)NEW MODELS TO FOLLOWToday we have two new designs, ready to be launched, and we are working on new patterns inspired by different colours and plants. During this campaign you can pre-order some of our new models with delivery from January 2021.EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / limited to 5 first sales (retail price: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (retail price: 175 €)EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / limited to 5 first sales (retail price: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (retail price: 175 €)BEHIND OUR CREATIONSThank you for your time and interest in our project!Weronika Anna Rosa & Xavier Bellot You can discover more at:www.weronikaanna-rosa.cominstagram:@weronikaanna_rosa (artistic work)@silk_by_weronikarosa (silk scarves) __________________________LA VERSION FRANÇAISE_________________________________L'IDÉENous avons créé notre marque en combinant nos designs peints à la main avec de la soie précieuse afin d’offrir de magnifiques foulards haut de gamme. Chacune de nos collections est limitée à un petit nombre d’exemplaires afin de garantir la qualité et l’originalité de nos créations.Les couleurs jouent un rôle vitale au quotidien. Dans cette première collection, nous avons essayé de jouer avec des combinaisons ambitieuses, apportant une touche de couleur compatible aussi bien avec des tenues élégantes qu’avec des ensembles décontractés. Plus qu’un simple accessoire, un foulard en soie peut, tel un bijou, transformer joliment une silhouette.LA QUALITÉ EST NOTRE PRIORITÉPour développer notre première collection, nous avons travaillé avec des artisans d’excellence, de la création du motif, à l’impression de la soie jusqu’aux dernières finitions. Tout cela avec le plus grand souci du détails. Notre mission fut de créer des pièces féminines, élégantes et modernes de grande qualité dont la valeur artistique est préservée. Nous avons réalisé des prototypes dans 3 pays différents, comparant la qualité et le rendu des couleurs. Nous avons testé différent type de soie pour identifier la matière la plus en phase abbé notre idée de foulard haut de gamme pour un usage au quotidien.Nous avons choisi le twill de soie grâce à sa texture riche, fluide et sans brillance délicate. Le twill garde sa forme à comparer au satin qui se froisse facilement.LES TRADITIONS & LE SAVOIR-FAIRE EUROPÉENSNos foulards sont fabriqué dans le nord de l’Italie dans la région de Côme. Nous avons fait ce choix car cette région dispose des conditions idéales pour produire la soie grâce à l’abondance des arbres de Mulberry et la qualité de ses eaux pures. Pendant plus de 500 ans, la production de soie de Côme dispose d’une réputation de qualité, de prestige et de raffinement.  100 % DES COULEURS INSPIRÉS PAR LA NATUREPour notre première collection, nous avons sélectionné 3 couleurs principales, directement inspirées par la nature:
ORANGE turmeric exprimant la joie et le bonheur
ROUGE carmin apportant forces & energie
VERT verdian souvent lié à l’équilibre et la confiance en soi.

Ces combinaisons de couleurs attirent le regard tout en étant délicate et embellissent le visage en y reflétant un trait de couleurs souvent bénéfiques pour le teint.INSPIRATIONS BOTANIQUESPour chaque motif, Weronika (expert en art botanique) a peint un « vocabulaire » de silhouette florale, en observant méticuleusement leur anatomie. Chaque élément est unique.COLLECTION LIMITÉEn attendant le lancement de notre magasin online, vous pouvez toujours commande nos étoffes en soie via cette plateforme et de profiter des prix de lancement.INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (prix public: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (prix public: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (prix public: 175 €) LES NOUVEAUX MODÈLES - EN PRÉPARATIONAujourd’hui, nous avons deux nouveaux designs, prêts au lancement. Nous travaillons, par ailleurs, sur de nouveaux motifs inspirés par des des plantes et des couleurs différentes. Lors de cette campagne, vous pouvez pré-commandez certains de nos nouveaux modèles avec une livraison attendue mi-Janvier 2021.EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / limité au 5 premières commandes (prix public: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (prix public: 175 €)EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / limité au 5 premières commandes (prix public: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (prix public: 175 €) DERRIÈRE NOS CREATIONSWeronika Anna Rosa est peintre et designer d'origine polonaise, residente à Lisbonne. Elle détient égallement un master en Histoire de l'Art.  Weronika est fascinée par la nature, en particulier par le monde de flore avec sa varieté des couleurs, forms et textures.Merci encore pour votre temps et votre intérêt envers notre projet!Weronika Anna Rosa & Xavier Bellot Pour en savoir plus:www.weronikaanna-rosa.cominstagram:@weronikaanna_rosa (création artistique personnelle)@silk_by_weronikarosa (foulards en soie) ________________________POLSKA WERSJA JĘZYKOWA____________________________NASZA HISTORIANasza marka została stworzona z zamiłowania do pięknych przedmiotów. Łączymy w niej ręcznie malowane projekty ze szlachetnym jedwabiem, oferując luksusowe szale o wysokim walorze artystycznym. Każda z naszych kolekcji jest realizowana w ramach limitowanych edycji w celu zapewnienia wyjątkowości i unikatowości naszych kreacji.Kolory odgrywają niezwykle istotną rolę w naszym życiu codziennym. W ramach naszej pierwszej kolekcji, proponujemy odważne kombinacje barwne, do noszenia na codzień, pasujące do eleganckich i niezobowiązujących ubrań. Jedwabny szal jest czymś więcej niż zwykłym dodatkiem, jest niczym biżuteria, która natychmiast odmieni Twój strój.JAKOŚĆ JEST NASZYM PRIORYTETEMRozwijając naszą pierwszą kolekcję, współpracowaliśmy z doskonałymi rzemieślnikami, specjalizującymi się w druku na jedwabiu i wykończeniach tego cennego materiału, z dbałością o każdy szczegół. Naszą misją było stworzenie kobiecych, eleganckich i nowoczesnych dodatków o najwyższej jakości. W tym celu, zrealizowaliśmy prototypy w 3 różnych krajach, porównując jakość i wierność kolorów. Przetestowaliśmy różne rodzaje jedwabiu i wybraliśmy jedwab typu Twill ze względu na jego bogatą teksturę, pięknie układające się fałdy i delikatny połysk. Twill nie gniecie się tak łatwo jak satyna jedwabna, co zapewnia mu nienaganny wygląd nawet po całodniowym noszeniu.EUROPEJSKIE TRADYCJE & SAVOIR-FAIRENasze szale są wykonywane na północy Włoch, w regionie Como. Ze względu na bogactwo drzew morwowych i krystalicznie czystą wodę, region ten posiada idealne warunki do produkcji jedwabiu. Od ponad 500 lat jedwabne tkaniny z Como są światowym symbolem jakości, prestiżu i wyrafinowania.100 % KOLORÓW INSPIROWANYCH NATURĄW ramach naszej pierwszej kolekcji wybraliśmy trzy główne kolory, bezpośrednio zainspirowane naturą:
pomarańcz kurkumy ""turmeric ORANGE"" wyrażająca radość i szczęcie
czerwień karminową ""carmin RED"" dająca witalność i energię
szmaragdowa zieleń ""verdian GREEN"" często kojarzona z dobrą równowagą pewnością siebie.

Harmonijne kompozycje kolorystyczne przyciągają wzrok, a barwy barwy delikatnie rozświetlone przez jedwabną tkaninę dodają twarzy szczególnego blasku i korzystnego wyglądu. BOTANICZNE INSPIRACJEDla każdego ze wzorów Weronika (specjalizująca się w sztuce botanicznej) namalowała bogate ""abecadło"" form kwiatowych, splecionych w organicznych kompozycjach. Podobnie jak w naturze, tak i na naszych chustach, każdy element jest unikatowy i nie występują powtórzenia.LIMITOWANA EDYCJA Oczekując na otwarcie naszego sklepu online, możecie wciąż  zamówić nasze jedwabne chusty poprzez tą platformę i skorzystać z korzystniejszych cen. INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (cena rynkowa: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (cena rynkowa: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (cena rynkowa: 175 €) NOWE WZORY WKRÓTCEDziś posiadamy dwa nowe projekty, przetestowane i gotowe do wprowadzenia, oraz pracujemy nad nowymi wzorami. Pomysłów nam nie brakuje! W ramach tej kampanii możesz zamówić nasze dwa nowe modele, z dostawą przewidzianą na połowę stycznia 2021 r.EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / jedynie dla 5 pierwszych zamówień (cena rynkowa: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (cena rynkowa: 175 €) EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: 115 € / jedynie dla 5 pierwszych zamówień (cena rynkowa: 175 €)INDIEGOGO SPECIAL: 130 € (cena rynkowa: 175 €)KTO STOI ZA NASZYMI KREACJAMI?Weronika Anna Rosa, malarka i projektantka polskiego pochodzenia, obecnie mieszkająca w Lizbonie. Z wykształcenia historyczka sztuki, Weronika czerpie inspiracje ze świata roślin, który stanowi niewyczerpalny repertuar form, kolorów i tekstur.   Dziękujemy za poświęcony czas i zainteresowanie naszym projektem!Weronika Anna Rosa i Xavier Bellot Dowiedz się więcej:www.weronikaanna-rosa.cominstagram:@weronikaanna_rosa (prace i projekty artystyczne) @silk_by_weronikarosa (chusty jedwabne)",51.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hello Potential Indiegogo Backers! Welcome to the campaign to Get Drawn As a Cartoon Character For Dirt Cheap!

 

 

WHY I'M RAISING FUNDS:

 

Hello, my name is Zoran Nova Corban. I am the writer, artist and cartoonist for the animation ""Angels of Accolade""

 

Because of the Virus I am no longer making enough money with Lyft and I am struggling with my bills. The best way for me to raise money at this time is to offer art with an offer ""you can't refuse""!

 

If I can raise enough in funding, I want to also build my Facebook page which currently has 1k followers. my goal is to build 10k followers so that I can successfully create a 20 minute cartoon for my story ""Angels of Accolade"". I want to make it into DVDs and hopefully one day have my animation featured on Adult Swim or Netflix.

 

I drive for Lyft to raise funds to make my dreams a reality, but the Virus became an issue and I am not making enough money anymore to accomplish my goals. It got so bad that I am not even making enough money to pay my rent!

 

I brainstormed Ideas to try and raise money to pay for rent and build my Facebook community... I decided to start a crowdfund!

 

I understand that no one is making any money at this time and to afford artwork is not possible... so I decided to make my artwork DIRT CHEAP!!!

 

Not only will I make my artwork cheap, I will also make it HIGH QUALITY... So take advantage of this amazing offer!

 

 

 

 

MY GOAL:

Since the beginning of this year, I decided to make my dreams a reality to create my very own cartoon. I saved up for months to afford the expensive equipment required to make this cartoon happen... The next step was to build my Facebook page to bring awareness to my animation ""Angels of Accolade"".

 

At first I was doing well and pulled off 1k followers who loves my artwork and story. I had a goal to reach 10k followers, but then the virus happened and my Lyft job suffered heavy because of it. 

 

I knew I had to come up with another way to raise funds to achieve my dreams... And that's why I decided to create this campaign!

 

 

 

 

 

 

THE PERKS

 

 

 

GET DRAW IN BLACK AND WHITE

 

 

 

 

You or your loved one will be drawn, no color. You can also be drawn with wings or horns.

 

 

 

 

 

GET DRAWN IN FULL COLOR $45 OFF

 

 

 

 

 

You or your loved one will be drawn in full color. You can also be an angel or demon. You can have wings or no wings. You can also choose whatever attire you want. 

 

 

 

 

ADD A STYLISH BACKGROUND!

 

 

 

 

 

A stylish background will be added to the picture

 

 

 

 

 

 

YOUR VERY OWN COMIC PAGE! FULL COLOR!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Get drawn in your very own comic page!

If you back this 20 times you can have your very own full comic!

The comic will be drawn in full color with text added.

 

 

 

 

WHERE FUNDS WILL GO!

 

 

The first $500 will help me to pay my rent!

Because of the Virus, I am not making much money with Lyft. I am struggling financially and your contributions will help me to pay my rent.

After paying my rent, I will use the remaining funds to grow my Facebook page with a goal to reach 10k followers.  I want there to be awareness for my cartoon ""Angels of Accolade"" and I believe building my Facebook page will help that happen!

So far My Facebook page has 1k followers and we have a wonderful and uplifting community. We share each others drawings and give each other advice. My Facebook community loves my drawings I post daily and I would love to spread the word of my animation to a bigger crowd.

 

 

STRETCH GOALS:

 

 

 

At $2,000: All backers will receive a free Comic PDF emailed!

 

At $5,000: I will create a 5 minute short animation and upload it on Youtube with all backers in the credits at the end of video!

 

At $10,000: All backers $25 and over will receive DOUBLE their backing!

 

 

THANK YOU for helping me in this journey to make ""ANGELS OF ACCOLADE"" a reality... Here are some more pics you will LOVE!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you can't contribute, please get the word out. 

 

Also please follow me on my Facebook page! http://www.facebook.com/Angels.of.Accolade

 

 

IMPORTANT: After backing please email me at skysonpt789@gmail.com with your contribution ID number and your picture you want me to draw! For the subject type ""BACKER"".

Ever wanted to recieve a nice letter in the mail instead of bills, termination notices, and those weird checks from a foreign country that you know damn well aren't real and most likely a scam? Well I have an idea that could potentionally better your day if even for a moment. The Dandy Doodle Drop is a personal and custom message with a doodle sent straight to your door based on a theme of your choice. Need some encouragement? Just ask and you'll open up a hand written message giving you that boost you need as well as a positive doodle. Just want to laugh? I'll send you a joke and a doodle that will hopefully put a smile on your face. With todays economy opening your mailbox can be a real drag so why not spice things up a bit? If the project is funded im looking to charge around $5 a month giving you 1 short message and doodle a week. This could be really fun and I look foward to all the silly themes you all will request. The funds will be used to buy stamps, envelopes, paper, pens, and whatever is left over helps me live and keep this idea going. Thanks and hopefully i will be writing and drawing for you all real soon

-Justin Irizarry

P.S. For examples of how i doodle visit my tumblr doctoririzarry.tumblr.com

OUR STORY:

For 5 years now, ART SLAMLIVE™ has been bringing visual artists and audiences together, painting LIVE while on stage, set to the sound of a DJ's turntable, vocalists and other performing acts. 6 ARTISTS, 1 STAGE, 1 D.J., ONE WINNER!

OUR CHALLENGE IN OCTOBER:

This year, we have the awesome opportunity to bring the show before our largest audience ever: Center Court of Haywood Mall, Greenville, SC!
This will be a large, moving audience, so we'll need to:

The Impact:

Over the past 5 years, ART SLAM LIVE™ has inspired participating artists to launch their own projects and ideas. We have even  been instrumental in connecting a art student with an internship that lead to a paid career position. Your support will allow us to continue this legacy.

I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Make some noise about this campaign! Get the word out to at least 2 people you know can help!

column7: >Union Project is a nonprofit arts and community organization
column14: > with a long history of connecting, creating, and celebrating community in our historic building.

column1: We are raising $5,000 to create 200 Clay Cases which will be used to provide ceramics programming in Pittsburgh schools.

The Clay Case is a studio-to-go.  It comes with everything needed to create with clay - a work mat with instructions, real ceramic tools, clay, glazes, and the artwork can come back to UP to be fired in our kilns.
Union Project has been
doing ceramics programming in schools for the last five years. <span>We recognized the need to go outside our building to
engage with people where they are.  At the same time, we recognized the
need in our local schools to integrate arts programming into curriculum to inspire students in new ways.
The Clay Case meets both of those
needs - providing mobile programming and deepening the classroom experience.  Curriculum can be integrated into a
Clay Case to make them useful for teachers and really impactful for
students.
Plus it’s a handy, fun tool that kids can take home, to extend that
learning with their families!
If we succeed in
raising the funds for this campaign, we'd be able to provide more programs in
schools,<span> at low cost or no-charge to the
school or students.  This is critical to
serve youth from low-income families. It would also allow us to increase the
number of schools that we work with and increase the number of students that
get to work with clay and own their own Clay Case.
With this success, UP will
continue to foster interaction and creative community building within the
greater community, just as we do every day within our building.
Our vision for the Clay Case is to continue bringing our studio – and authentic ceramic experiences - into families’ homes and schools all over Pittsburgh.
What We Need &

We need to raise $5,000 to buy all the supplies that go into the Clay Case, print more Clay Case boxes and work mats, cover the cost of firing finished artwork in our kiln, and send ceramic artists into schools to teach lessons with the Clay Cases.
If we don’t quite
reach our goal, <span>we won't be able to make
as many Clay Cases, we may not be able to give them to schools for free, and we
won't be able to send them in with a ceramic artist - a critical link in integrating
clay into existing curriculum. In
order to fully provide an authentic clay learning experience to children, we
need to raise the full $5,000.
Our
unique perks include one-of-a-kind, handmade artwork from artists on staff and in
our community.  We’ve worked with them to
create drawings of our stained glass windows, images of Union Project, a
special edition ceramic mug, and a slate of high-end ceramic art!
The Impact
By supporting this project you will help take ceramics programming out of our studio and put it directly into students' hands in classrooms.
When students learn how to create with clay, they
get excited and take more ownership and care in their work. They are proud to
share their learning with their friends and families.
Donate today and help ensure that arts education through the Clay Case is available for all our communities’ children.

Other Ways You Can Help

Once you've made your donation, please help us spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and family!
Check Out These Sweet Perks!

Union Project is a nonprofit arts and community organization with a long history of connecting, creating, and celebrating community in our historic building.
We are raising $5,000 to create 200 Clay Cases which will be used to provide ceramics programming in Pittsburgh schools.

The Clay Case is a studio-to-go.  It comes with everything needed to create with clay - a work mat with instructions, real ceramic tools, clay, glazes, and the artwork can come back to UP to be fired in our kilns.
Union Project has been
doing ceramics programming in schools for the last five years. We recognized the need to go outside our building to
engage with people where they are.  At the same time, we recognized the
need in our local schools to integrate arts programming into curriculum to inspire students in new ways.
The Clay Case meets both of those
needs - providing mobile programming and deepening the classroom experience.  Curriculum can be integrated into a
Clay Case to make them useful for teachers and really impactful for
students.
Plus it’s a handy, fun tool that kids can take home, to extend that
learning with their families!
If we succeed in
raising the funds for this campaign, we'd be able to provide more programs in
schools, at low cost or no-charge to the
school or students.  This is critical to
serve youth from low-income families. It would also allow us to increase the
number of schools that we work with and increase the number of students that
get to work with clay and own their own Clay Case.
With this success, UP will
continue to foster interaction and creative community building within the
greater community, just as we do every day within our building.
Our vision for the Clay Case is to continue bringing our studio – and authentic ceramic experiences - into families’ homes and schools all over Pittsburgh.
What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $5,000 to buy all the supplies that go into the Clay Case, print more Clay Case boxes and work mats, cover the cost of firing finished artwork in our kiln, and send ceramic artists into schools to teach lessons with the Clay Cases.
If we don’t quite
reach our goal, we won't be able to make
as many Clay Cases, we may not be able to give them to schools for free, and we
won't be able to send them in with a ceramic artist - a critical link in integrating
clay into existing curriculum. In
order to fully provide an authentic clay learning experience to children, we
need to raise the full $5,000.
Our
unique perks include one-of-a-kind, handmade artwork from artists on staff and in
our community.  We’ve worked with them to
create drawings of our stained glass windows, images of Union Project, a
special edition ceramic mug, and a slate of high-end ceramic art!
The Impact
By supporting this project you will help take ceramics programming out of our studio and put it directly into students' hands in classrooms.
When students learn how to create with clay, they
get excited and take more ownership and care in their work. They are proud to
share their learning with their friends and families.
Donate today and help ensure that arts education through the Clay Case is available for all our communities’ children.
Other Ways You Can Help Once you've made your donation, please help us spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and family!

column4: >Gallery walls and stages are the traditional arenas for

column1: showcasing creativity and self-expression. Writerz Blok, however, offers a space
for the atypical artist. What began as an alternative method to reduce
vandalism and tagging in Southeastern San Diego developed into a nationally
recognized urban arts program. Since 1999, we have been at the forefront of a
community-led effort to channel the flair of graffiti into a pathway for artistic
and career opportunities, and transform blight into beauty.
column4: >
column7: >As the first public graffiti art park in the nation, we

column1: offer a free space for everyone across the spectrum, from youth who volunteer
and seek a hangout spot, to internationally renowned graffiti artists who share
their knowledge with aspiring artists. Our yard also serves as a stage for
various events featuring hip-hop MCs and DJs, dance crews, and live graffiti art
demonstrations.
column4: >Writerz Blok continues to develop its young artists

column1: through regular educational workshops that prepare them for careers in creative
fields. Currently, our programs include basic training in screen-printing,
graphic design, and graffiti art history for local middle and high school
students. However, we are limited on resources and lack the proper space to consistently
provide classes to our students.
The new programs are designed to target at-youth risk
who have been through the Juvenile Justice system. These are youth who come
from low-income homes and have been neglected either at home or their schools.  Our mission is to provide the underserved youth
with the resources to explore their own creative interests and inspire them to
be thinkers, creators, and doers. We want to be the catalyst in their lives that
encourages them to aspire to be creative professionals and entrepreneurs.
By helping us raise $25,000 to expand our space and
programs you are playing a vital role in the lives of these students. Help be
that life changing experience for a future generation.

column7: >
column10: >By raising $25,000 we plan to build classroom space to

column1: expand our programs and renovate our entire graffiti art yard. Our renovated yard will be an anchor for the
creative industries developing in the neighborhood and serve as a space for
youth innovation and entrepreneurship.
All
your donations will go to…
1.
CLASSROOM SPACE &
As a burgeoning social enterprise we plan to
provide creative career pathways for at-risk youth through hands-on job
training programs focused on art and technology that will serve as a pipeline leading
them to the creative industry sector.
New pop-up structures will be used as classrooms,
doubling the size and reach of our youth program, to provide training in
graphic design, web development, screen-printing, and coding. A third structure
will serve as a retail store to sell special edition apparel and skateboards
featuring unique designs by renowned graffiti artists, providing students with
retail and management work experience and empower us to generate revenue to
support our programs.
2.
THE YARD:
Our yard offers a space for arts learning and
exchanges that foster creative and divergent thinking. These are factors needed
to support emerging artists and youth entrepreneurship.
Our graffiti walls will be restored and redesigned
to create more space for local and international artists to showcase their art.
The yard will serve as a vibrant backdrop for our youth programs to take place
and provide a stage for engaging community art events.
The new yard will be
an anchor for the creative industries developing in the neighborhood and serve
as a space for youth innovation and entrepreneurship.
How
you can help us…
By donating to Writerz Blok, you are helping expand our
arts programming to serve more youth and prepare them with the skills they need
to compete for careers in creative industries. In addition to donating, you can
be part of the expansion by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign
to your friends and family.
Find more about us here:
https://www.facebook.com/WriterzBlok/?ref=tn_tnmn

https://www.instagram.com/writerzbloksd/

http://www.voiceofsandiego.org/all-narratives/public-art/culture-report/
How
we thank you…
At the end of the campaign we will launch
the first of our quarterly “Art at the Yard” events. In appreciation of your
donations, we invite all contributors and supporters to attend. Student
exhibitions will be held at the event to showcase their work and dedication.
It’s important for us to invest in the well-being of
our community. At-risk youth need our support, by inspiring them and providing
the resources to succeed. By donating you are opening many closed doors to new
and exciting career pathways that can be life changing experiences. <span>If more young adults are on career pathways, the
overall community is more likely to achieve economic mobility and security.
Thank you for helping create a better future. We

greatly appreciate your donations and remember to spread the word! 


","Gallery walls and stages are the traditional arenas for
showcasing creativity and self-expression. Writerz Blok, however, offers a space
for the atypical artist. What began as an alternative method to reduce
vandalism and tagging in Southeastern San Diego developed into a nationally
recognized urban arts program. Since 1999, we have been at the forefront of a
community-led effort to channel the flair of graffiti into a pathway for artistic
and career opportunities, and transform blight into beauty.As the first public graffiti art park in the nation, we
offer a free space for everyone across the spectrum, from youth who volunteer
and seek a hangout spot, to internationally renowned graffiti artists who share
their knowledge with aspiring artists. Our yard also serves as a stage for
various events featuring hip-hop MCs and DJs, dance crews, and live graffiti art
demonstrations.Writerz Blok continues to develop its young artists
through regular educational workshops that prepare them for careers in creative
fields. Currently, our programs include basic training in screen-printing,
graphic design, and graffiti art history for local middle and high school
students. However, we are limited on resources and lack the proper space to consistently
provide classes to our students.
The new programs are designed to target at-youth risk
who have been through the Juvenile Justice system. These are youth who come
from low-income homes and have been neglected either at home or their schools.  Our mission is to provide the underserved youth
with the resources to explore their own creative interests and inspire them to
be thinkers, creators, and doers. We want to be the catalyst in their lives that
encourages them to aspire to be creative professionals and entrepreneurs.
By helping us raise $25,000 to expand our space and
programs you are playing a vital role in the lives of these students. Help be
that life changing experience for a future generation.
By raising $25,000 we plan to build classroom space to
expand our programs and renovate our entire graffiti art yard. Our renovated yard will be an anchor for the
creative industries developing in the neighborhood and serve as a space for
youth innovation and entrepreneurship.
All
your donations will go to…
CLASSROOM SPACE & POP-UP STORE:
As a burgeoning social enterprise we plan to
provide creative career pathways for at-risk youth through hands-on job
training programs focused on art and technology that will serve as a pipeline leading
them to the creative industry sector.
New pop-up structures will be used as classrooms,
doubling the size and reach of our youth program, to provide training in
graphic design, web development, screen-printing, and coding. A third structure
will serve as a retail store to sell special edition apparel and skateboards
featuring unique designs by renowned graffiti artists, providing students with
retail and management work experience and empower us to generate revenue to
support our programs.
THE YARD:
Our yard offers a space for arts learning and
exchanges that foster creative and divergent thinking. These are factors needed
to support emerging artists and youth entrepreneurship.
Our graffiti walls will be restored and redesigned
to create more space for local and international artists to showcase their art.
The yard will serve as a vibrant backdrop for our youth programs to take place
and provide a stage for engaging community art events.
The new yard will be
an anchor for the creative industries developing in the neighborhood and serve
as a space for youth innovation and entrepreneurship.
How
you can help us…
By donating to Writerz Blok, you are helping expand our
arts programming to serve more youth and prepare them with the skills they need
to compete for careers in creative industries. In addition to donating, you can
be part of the expansion by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign
to your friends and family.
Find more about us here:

https://www.instagram.com/writerzbloksd/http://www.voiceofsandiego.org/all-narratives/public-art/culture-report/
How
we thank you…
At the end of the campaign we will launch
the first of our quarterly “Art at the Yard” events. In appreciation of your
donations, we invite all contributors and supporters to attend. Student
exhibitions will be held at the event to showcase their work and dedication.
It’s important for us to invest in the well-being of
our community. At-risk youth need our support, by inspiring them and providing
the resources to succeed. By donating you are opening many closed doors to new
and exciting career pathways that can be life changing experiences. If more young adults are on career pathways, the
overall community is more likely to achieve economic mobility and security.
Thank you for helping create a better future. We

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3 style=""text-align: justify
T H E      I D E A

Our studio is a 30-foot-long moving truck where one of it's walls folds down into a giant stage, revealing a wild live glass blowing show. Our craft features 1200 degree celsius molten glass, fire, a collision of creative ideas, sassy humor, fire, and fire.
Now imagine taking this truck on tour across North America...
welcome to the Glass House Fine Art Collective - Indiegogo campaign.

column3:
/>

In 2015, Mandy Patchin and I, Kai Scholefield founded this artist's company and successfully built a fully functioning hot glass blowing studio in our very own moving truck! (Yes, we did) The first of its kind in Canada.

column1: As professional glass blowers, and divas for public attention, we traveled across western Canada, testing our vehicle &
column2: equipment while performing glass blowing feats, telling jokes, and solving crimes (Mandy is a regular Miss Marple).

column1: After performing live shows for thousands of people both indoors and outside at festivals, or hosting small
classes for all age groups, the overwhelming feedback from all demographics has been incredibly positive.
So far, our experience has been that this shared experience cultivates awareness and appreciation for art, and each other.

We are spearheading a passion driven initiative, the mission of which is to create an enterprise out of our sincere desire to share our ideas of art and fun through the burning hot lens of liquid sand.
As we have gained momentum, and a flair for the dramatic, we noted that we were ready for the next step, a larger road trip.
T H E      P R O J E C T
This campaign, if funded, will enable us to literally take this dream farther than ever before, bringing our antics and sense of humor to communities in dire need of each across North America.

All contributions and support will:

  • Help weather proof the mobile studio by building a adaptable stage cover and framework so we can perform and provide enclosures for shows in rain, snow, tornadoes and hurricanes.
  • Fund permits and licenses in the many wonderful places, and festivals to be visited.
• Provide power- it takes a lot of electricity to put on a good show! Approximately, 30,000 watts of electricity and a special generator is required to power our studio and keep the glass molten hot!
<ul>
If we don't reach our funding goal, we will thank our supporters, but unfortunately won't be able to make needed changes to our truck, nor power a tour.
R E W A R D S

High Five: $5


With this gift, you will send us on our way with best wishes and receive blown kisses and air hugs from Kai and Mandy from afar (xoxoxo).

Glass Blower Starter Gear: $20


The most critical gear in a glass blowers' utility belt is their shades, they protect against UV rays, hot glass, and make you impenetrably cool. Bring these shades to our shows and we'll point you out for your support!
column3:
/>


A Taste For Beer Tumblers: $35


Included with our sun glasses, we will also include a beer tumbler reincarnated from your favorite brand of alcohol (shipping included in CAN, 22% off regular price).


A Taste For Color: $50


Included with our sun glasses, we will send you a hand blown drinking glass, made from colors of your choosing (shipping included in CAN, 20% off regular price).


Your Name Here Forever: $100


We will send you TWO drinking glasses, made from colors of your choosing, and add your name to our truck in the founders section (shipping included in CAN, 20% off regular price).


More Than A Name: $150


In addition to immortalizing your name on our truck, we will send you one of our colorful vases, and pair of sun glasses (shipping included in CAN, 33% off regular price).


Color is Better: $250


In addition to sun glasses, we will send you a hand blown vase, made from colors of your choosing (shipping included in CAN, 17% off regular price).


In Your Hands: $400


In addition to sun glasses, and a hand blown vase, you will partake in a 2 day glass blowing class in this unique studio (shipping included in CAN, 33% off regular price).


More Than In Your Hands: $550


In addition to sun glasses, and a 2 day glass blowing class, you will receive a custom blown vase, made from colors of your choosing (shipping included in CAN, 20% off regular price).


Better In Pairs: $800


A 2 day class for 2 lucky people to tame the wild hot glass together, including 2 pairs of sunglasses, and a custom blown vase made with colors of your choosing (shipping included in CAN, 25% off regular price).


Private VIP Party: $4500


You have your own personal glass blowing show for a whole day ( 8 hours), featuring 2 shows every hour, glass work giveaways, classes, team building, and a lot of excitement (Alberta, Canada only, additional days available 10% off regular price).
","T H E      I D E A

column1: Our studio is a 30-foot-long moving truck where one of it's walls folds down into a giant stage, revealing a wild live glass blowing show. Our craft features 1200 degree celsius molten glass, fire, a collision of creative ideas, sassy humor, fire, and fire.
Now imagine taking this truck on tour across North America...
welcome to the Glass House Fine Art Collective - Indiegogo campaign.

In 2015, Mandy Patchin and I, Kai Scholefield founded this artist's company and successfully built a fully functioning hot glass blowing studio in our very own moving truck! (Yes, we did) The first of its kind in Canada.

As professional glass blowers, and divas for public attention, we traveled across western Canada, testing our vehicle & equipment while performing glass blowing feats, telling jokes, and solving crimes (Mandy is a regular Miss Marple).
After performing live shows for thousands of people both indoors and outside at festivals, or hosting small
classes for all age groups, the overwhelming feedback from all demographics has been incredibly positive.
So far, our experience has been that this shared experience cultivates awareness and appreciation for art, and each other.

We are spearheading a passion driven initiative, the mission of which is to create an enterprise out of our sincere desire to share our ideas of art and fun through the burning hot lens of liquid sand.
As we have gained momentum, and a flair for the dramatic, we noted that we were ready for the next step, a larger road trip.
T H E      P R O J E C T
This campaign, if funded, will enable us to literally take this dream farther than ever before, bringing our antics and sense of humor to communities in dire need of each across North America.

All contributions and support will:  Help weather proof the mobile studio by building a adaptable stage cover and framework so we can perform and provide enclosures for shows in rain, snow, tornadoes and hurricanes.  Fund permits and licenses in the many wonderful places, and festivals to be visited.
Provide power- it takes a lot of electricity to put on a good show! Approximately, 30,000 watts of electricity and a special generator is required to power our studio and keep the glass molten hot!
If we don't reach our funding goal, we will thank our supporters, but unfortunately won't be able to make needed changes to our truck, nor power a tour.
R E W A R D S

Our journey as a couple started almost four years ago.  On our fifth date we created an art installation at a recording studio in Minneapolis, MN.  We covered the pillars of the sound gallery with our love of art.

We have been creating public art around the United States and Spain for over the past four years.
column4:
> 

We are raising funds to purchase the materials used to complete a 15 feet by 45 feet mural in Uptown Minneapolis, MN. With your help we will be able to purchase the paint, brushes, and rollers to complete this project.
column6:
> 

We believe in the importance of building community and enriching the world with the beauty of art.  Please share this with your friends and neighbors in Minneapolis, MN. 

 

Sincerely,

 

Brook &

What is Aegir?

Aegir is a new literary magazine publishing art, short fiction, and poetry about displacement and anxiety in a world where terrible things always happen but also waffles exist. We are currently designing the first issue and are looking for pre-orders to help afford higher production costs.
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

We are a small group of artists/editors based out of Bridgewater, MA. Our team edited and designed a successful student publication last year and with our collective skills/semi-legal copies of Indesign, we are making Aegir.
Why We Need Your Help

Printing a high quality product cost money and that’s why we need your help. We are using Indiegogo as a platform for pre-orders so we can produce a higher quality magazine. I'm talking about fancy paper. I'm talking about ink that smells nice. Simply put, the more pre-orders we sell, the more money we can put into production.

At Aegir, we are fascinated by the relationship between design and storytelling. We want our magazine to be a model of merging art and literature. Heres a few quick examples of what our design team has been up to so far and what you can expect from the finished product.
<h3>Sample Spreads<span style=""font-size: 16px
<div><span style=""font-size: 16px
<div><span style=""font-weight: normal
<div><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >(final spread designs are subject to change)

column1: <div><span style=""font-weight: normal
<div><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >Our goal for this first issue is to establish Aegir as a Lit Mag that publishes unique and powerful voices. One of our favorites is Dee Mac. She is an amazing poet and writer and we are so happy to be publishing her work. Check out this reading Dee Mac gave us of one of her poems from the first issue.

column1: <div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FzcRdGf86lRI%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp

If You Can't Donate

We totally get if you can’t contribute right now. (We are broke too!) But we appreciate any help spreading our campaign.
Our Future

We need your help to make this first edition of Aegir great but we don’t plan on stopping there. Our goal is for Aegir to be a jumping off point to launch a new independent publisher know as tidal bore press. We want to continue to create new projects and work with all the talented artists and writers we’ve met and who we will meet. If you help us start Aegir today we know that soon we’ll be doing all kinds of cool stuff that you can read while petting your dog.

Thanks for your support!

And a special thanks to the contributors featured in the Indiegogo campaign. (Sarah Hamburger, DJ Nelson, Ryan Nicholson, Dee Mac, and Marina Santiago)

Gallery of Images: Enchanted Blog link

Short Summary

Hi! I'm Kira Sanoja the creator of this fine art photography project called Kandylane Enchanted.

Over the past year, with the help of family and friends, we have created some beautiful characters and scenes that help tell stories about experiences and dreams in my life. Through a series of pictures, we have even told my sister's chilling story about her battle and triumph over cancer, featuring her as the model.

The ability to share this project with more of the world means so much to me!
What We Need &amp
<li>

The first bulk order of 2015 calendars will cost at least $2500. Preparing inventory of high quality custom frame prints, canvases, and metal prints will be close to $5000. Participating in a few art shows will be at least $1000. In addition, makeup, fabric, props, supplies, etc. for future shoots will cost (and has already cost us) $1000+.
<li>I'm so excited to offer this calendar &amp
column2: the VERY FIRST PRINTS as perks! Honestly, I'm actually just starting to offer products, and this campaign will provide me with a little extra for the gallery I want to put together. I truly believe that everyone, from little girls to grown adults to art and photography enthusiasts, will find a way to connect to this project. Here is a link that will show you the images with the corresponding number: Enchanted Blog

column1: • If my entire goal is not reached, I will absolutely keep my promise on the perks for contributors! And if I happen to go OVER my goal, I will come up with something really good to do with the extra funds!
The impact
• Up to this point, we have mainly been able to share this project via social media. It has been wonderful, but having these images in homes around the world will be a dream come true!
<li>For me, this project has been like an open journal for anyone and everyone to see. I talk about my weaknesses &amp
column2: strengths and how I've been able to overcome obstacles. If I have even impacted one person, I will feel so fulfilled.

column1: • I am so thankful that this project has reached over one hundred thousand people so far with the help of social media! It's had 2 print publications, winning a People's Choice award in Rangefinder magazine, as well as a 10 page spread in Enchanting Photography magazine!
Risks &

• Hundreds of hours have gone into this project, by not only myself, but by the hands of a couple dozen volunteers. Thousands of dollars have been spent gathering supplies, traveling, and upgrading equipment. All of this has been done in hopes of uplifting others and sharing beauty, but with faith that it could become more than just a hobby. None of these things have really been a concern to me because it's what I love. If all this does is to bring a little more happiness into a few more lives, then I will know our time was well spent.
• I know that I will do everything in my power to promote this project, and I know that I am backed by so many amazing supporters who have just as much faith in it as I do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
<li>
I know there have been many times in my life where I've wanted to help, but I just didn't have the means. If this just isn't the time for you, that is totally ok, but please share!
• Indiegogo makes it so easy to share! Make sure you utilize that!

And that's all there is to it!

Again... Here is a link to my blog with all of the pictures to choose from and with their corresponding number: Enchanted Blog

Hi! I'm Kira Sanoja the creator of this fine art photography project called Kandylane Enchanted. Over the past year, with the help of family and friends, we have created some beautiful characters and scenes that help tell stories about experiences and dreams in my life. Through a series of pictures, we have even told my sister's chilling story about her battle and triumph over cancer, featuring her as the model.The ability to share this project with more of the world means so much to me!
What We Need & What You Get

The first bulk order of 2015 calendars will cost at least $2500. Preparing inventory of high quality custom frame prints, canvases, and metal prints will be close to $5000. Participating in a few art shows will be at least $1000. In addition, makeup, fabric, props, supplies, etc. for future shoots will cost (and has already cost us) $1000+.

I'm so excited to offer this calendar & the VERY FIRST PRINTS as perks! Honestly, I'm actually just starting to offer products, and this campaign will provide me with a little extra for the gallery I want to put together. I truly believe that everyone, from little girls to grown adults to art and photography enthusiasts, will find a way to connect to this project. Here is a link that will show you the images with the corresponding number: Enchanted Blog

If my entire goal is not reached, I will absolutely keep my promise on the perks for contributors! And if I happen to go OVER my goal, I will come up with something really good to do with the extra funds!
The impact
Up to this point, we have mainly been able to share this project via social media. It has been wonderful, but having these images in homes around the world will be a dream come true!

For me, this project has been like an open journal for anyone and everyone to see. I talk about my weaknesses & strengths and how I've been able to overcome obstacles. If I have even impacted one person, I will feel so fulfilled.

I am so thankful that this project has reached over one hundred thousand people so far with the help of social media! It's had 2 print publications, winning a People's Choice award in Rangefinder magazine, as well as a 10 page spread in Enchanting Photography magazine!
Risks & Challenges

Hundreds of hours have gone into this project, by not only myself, but by the hands of a couple dozen volunteers. Thousands of dollars have been spent gathering supplies, traveling, and upgrading equipment. All of this has been done in hopes of uplifting others and sharing beauty, but with faith that it could become more than just a hobby. None of these things have really been a concern to me because it's what I love. If all this does is to bring a little more happiness into a few more lives, then I will know our time was well spent.
I know that I will do everything in my power to promote this project, and I know that I am backed by so many amazing supporters who have just as much faith in it as I do.
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
I know there have been many times in my life where I've wanted to help, but I just didn't have the means. If this just isn't the time for you, that is totally ok, but please share!
Indiegogo makes it so easy to share! Make sure you utilize that!
And that's all there is to it!Again... Here is a link to my blog with all of the pictures to choose from and with their corresponding number: Enchanted Blog",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

<h1><span style=""background-color: initial

column2: >77 ist eine etwa 160 Seiten umfassende Publikation die sowohl als Printmedium als auch online erhältlich sein und publiziert werden soll. Siebenundsiebzig Doppelseiten bilden den Inhalt, wobei jede einzelne von einem/r unterschiedlichen KünstlerIn gestaltet wurde. Es gibt also keine journalistischen Inhalte im klassischen Sinn, das Magazin besteht voll und ganz aus individuell kreierten Beiträgen.

column1: Helft mit, das 77-Magazin drucken zu lassen und setzt somit ein Zeichen für Kunst und Kultur abseits von Industrie, Anzeigen-Auflagen-Spiralen und Markt-Abhängigkeiten!
<div>
Was sind unsere Inhalte?

Wir haben die unterschiedlichsten Menschen dazu eingeladen, jeweils eine Doppelseite völlig frei zu gestalten. Egal ob es sich dabei um Fotografie, Grafik, Poesie oder Graffiti, Konkretes oder Abstraktes handelte – alles war erlaubt! Und so vielfältig und ungestüm wie die Vorgabe sind auch die Kunstwerke geworden, die uns KünstlerInnen, FotografInnen, SchriftstellerInnen, MusikerInnen, WissenschafterInnen und allerlei sonstige kreative Menschen aus allen Ecken der Erde zusandten und die einen verblüffenden Querschnitt durch eine junge und aufstrebende Kultur darstellen.
Warum 77?

77 sieht sich in diesem Sinne als ein “alternativer Filter” für Kultur. Das Ziel ist es, nicht nur durch spannende Beiträge und Inhalte zu unterhalten, sondern damit auch den vielen unbekannten ProduzentInnen, DenkerInnen und BeobachterInnen unserer Gegenwart ein Gesicht und eine Präsentationsfläche zu bieten.
Wie könnt ihr helfen?
• Einmal natürlich indem ihr unsere Kampagne unterstützt und dafür einen unserer vielen tollen Perks bekommt!
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Aber es wäre auch super, wenn ihr einfach allen Menschen die ihr kennt von 77 erzählt, es auf Facebook teilt, tweetet oder sonstwie eure Freunde daran teilhaben lasst!
